It was narrated from Anas bin Malik that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

مَنْ سَأَلَ الْقَضَاءَ وُكِلَ إِلَى نَفْسِهِ وَمَنْ جُبِرَ عَلَيْهِ نَزَلَ إِلَيْهِ مَلَكٌ فَسَدَّدَهُ

Whoever asks to be appointed a judge, will be entrusted to himself, but “Whoever asks to be appointed a judge, will be entrusted to himself, but whoever is forced to accept position, an angel will come down to him and guide him.

Sunan Ibn Majah 2309

It was narrated that 'Ali said:

بَعَثَنِي رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم إِلَى الْيَمَنِ فَقُلْتُ يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ تَبْعَثُنِي وَأَنَا شَابٌّ أَقْضِي بَيْنَهُمْ وَلاَ أَدْرِي مَا الْقَضَاءُ قَالَ فَضَرَبَ فِي صَدْرِي بِيَدِهِ ثُمَّ قَالَ ‏ "‏ اللَّهُمَّ اهْدِ قَلْبَهُ وَثَبِّتْ لِسَانَهُ ‏"‏ ‏.‏ قَالَ فَمَا شَكَكْتُ بَعْدُ فِي قَضَاءٍ بَيْنَ اثْنَيْنِ.

The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) sent me to Yemen. I said: 'O Messenger of Allah, you are sending me to judge between them while I am a young man, and I do not know how to judge.' He struck me on the chest with his hand and said: 'O Allah, guide his heart and make his tongue steadfast.' And after that I never doubted in passing judgment between two people.

Sunan Ibn Majah 2310

Narrated Aisha, Ummul Mu'minin: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) commanded us:

أَمَرَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم بِبِنَاءِ الْمَسَاجِدِ فِي الدُّورِ وَأَنْ تُنَظَّفَ وَتُطَيَّبَ

to build mosques in different localities (i.e. in the locality of each tribe separately) and that they should be kept clean and be perfumed.

Sunan Abi Dawud 455

Narrated Maymunah ibn Sa'd: I said: Messenger of Allah, tell us the legal injunction about (visiting) Bayt al-Muqaddas (the dome of the Rock at Jerusalem). The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

ائْتُوهُ فَصَلُّوا فِيهِ وَكَانَتِ الْبِلاَدُ إِذْ ذَاكَ حَرْبًا - فَإِنْ لَمْ تَأْتُوهُ وَتُصَلُّوا فِيهِ فَابْعَثُوا بِزَيْتٍ يُسْرَجُ فِي قَنَادِيلِهِ

go and pray there. All the cities at that time were effected by war. If you cannot visit it and pray there, then send some oil to be used in the lamps.

Sunan Abi Dawud 457

Footnote:

In this hadith, encouragement has been given to donate to the mosque.

Abu Hurairah reported:I heard the Messenger of Allah (May peace be upon him) as saying;

مَنْ سَمِعَ رَجُلاً يَنْشُدُ ضَالَّةً فِي الْمَسْجِدِ فَلْيَقُلْ لاَ أَدَّاهَا اللَّهُ إِلَيْكَ فَإِنَّ الْمَسَاجِدَ لَمْ تُبْنَ لِهَذَا

if anyone hears a man crying out in the mosque about something he has lost, he should say: May Allah not restore it to you, for the mosque were not built for this.

Sunan Abi Dawud 473

Ibn Abbas narrated:

أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم خَرَجَ مِنَ الْمَدِينَةِ إِلَى مَكَّةَ لاَ يَخَافُ إِلاَّ اللَّهَ رَبَّ الْعَالَمِينَ فَصَلَّى رَكْعَتَيْنِ

The Prophet went from Al-Madinah to Makkah, not fearing anyone except Allah the Lord of the worlds, and he prayed two Rak'ah.

Jami` at-Tirmidhi 547

It was narrated from Abu Shuraih Al-Khuzai that the Prophet(ﷺ) said:

مَنْ كَانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الآخِرِ فَلْيُحْسِنْ إِلَى جَارِهِ وَمَنْ كَانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الآخِرِ فَلْيُكْرِمْ ضَيْفَهُ وَمَنْ كَانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الآخِرِ فَلْيَقُلْ خَيْرًا أَوْ لِيَسْكُتْ

Whoever believes in the Last Day, let him treat his neighbour well. Whoever believes in Allah and Last Day, let him honor his guest. Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, let him say something good or else remain silent

Sunan Ibn Majah 3672

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah that the Messenger of Allah(ﷺ) said:

اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أُحَرِّجُ حَقَّ الضَّعِيفَيْنِ الْيَتِيمِ وَالْمَرْأَةِ ‏

O Allah, bear witness that I have issued a warning concerning (failure to fulfill) the rights of the two weak ones: Orphans and women.

Sunan Ibn Majah 3678

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah that the Messenger of Allah(ﷺ) said:

خَيْرُ بَيْتٍ فِي الْمُسْلِمِينَ بَيْتٌ فِيهِ يَتِيمٌ يُحْسَنُ إِلَيْهِ وَشَرُّ بَيْتٍ فِي الْمُسْلِمِينَ بَيْتٌ فِيهِ يَتِيمٌ يُسَاءُ إِلَيْهِ

The best house among the Muslims is a house in which there is an orphan who is treated well. And the worst house among the Muslims is a house in which there is an orphan who is treated badly.

Sunan Ibn Majah 3679

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

تَبٰرَكَ الَّذِیْ بِیَدِهِ الْمُلْكُ ؗ وَ هُوَ عَلٰی كُلِّ شَیْءٍ قَدِیْرُۙ۝۱ ِ۟

Glorious is He, in whose hand is the Kingdom (of the whole universe), and He is powerful over every thing.

Surah Mulk, V : 1

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

الَّذِیْ خَلَقَ الْمَوْتَ وَ الْحَیٰوةَ لِیَبْلُوَكُمْ اَیُّكُمْ اَحْسَنُ عَمَلًا ؕ وَ هُوَ الْعَزِیْزُ الْغَفُوْرُۙ۝۲

[He] who created death and life to test you [as to] which of you is the best in deed - and He is the All-Mighty, the Most-Forgiving.

Surah Mulk, V : 2

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

الَّذِیْ خَلَقَ سَبْعَ سَمٰوٰتٍ طِبَاقًا ؕ مَا تَرٰی فِیْ خَلْقِ الرَّحْمٰنِ مِنْ تَفٰوُتٍ ؕ فَارْجِعِ الْبَصَرَ ۙ هَلْ تَرٰی مِنْ فُطُوْرٍ۝۳

who has created seven skies, one over the other. You will see nothing out of proportion in the creation of the RaHmān (the All-Merciful Allah). So, cast your eye again. Do you see any rifts?

Surah Mulk, V : 3

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

قُلۡ اَئِنَّکُمۡ لَتَکۡفُرُوۡنَ بِالَّذِیۡ خَلَقَ الۡاَرۡضَ فِیۡ یَوۡمَیۡنِ وَتَجۡعَلُوۡنَ لَہٗۤ اَنۡدَادًا ؕ ذٰلِکَ رَبُّ الۡعٰلَمِیۡنَ

Say, “Do you really disbelieve in the One who has created the earth in two days, and attribute to Him equals? That is the Lord of the worlds."

Surah Hameem Sijda (Fussilat), v : 9

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَلَا یَـُٔوۡدُہٗ حِفۡظُہُمَا ۚ وَہُوَ الۡعَلِیُّ الۡعَظِیۡمُ

It does not weary Him to look after them (the Heavens and the Earth). He is the All-High, the Supreme.

Surah Al-Baqarah, verse: 255

Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:“May his nose be rubbed in dust! May his nose be rubbed in dust!! May his nose be rubbed in dust!!!”The Companions asked, “Whose nose, O Messenger of Allah?”He replied:

مَنْ أَدْرَكَ وَالِدَيْهِ عِنْدَ الْكِبْرِ، أَوْ أَحَدَهُمَا، فَدَخَلَ النَّارَ‏.‏

The one who finds his parents, or one of them, in their old age, yet he still enters the Hellfire.

Al-Adab al-Mufrad, 21

Abu Hurairah (RA) said: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

ثَلاَثُ دَعَوَاتٍ مُسْتَجَابَاتٌ لَهُنَّ، لاَ شَكَّ فِيهِنَّ‏:‏ دَعْوَةُ الْمَظْلُومِ، وَدَعْوَةُ الْمُسَافِرِ، وَدَعْوَةُ الْوَالِدِيْنِ عَلَى وَلَدِهِمَا‏.‏

Three supplications are surely answered, about which there is no doubt: the supplication of the oppressed, the supplication of the traveler, and the supplication of the parents against their child.

Al-Adab al-Mufrad, 32

Sahl ibn Mu‘adh, on the authority of his father, reported that the Prophet (ﷺ) said:

مَنْ بَرَّ وَالِدَيْهِ طُوبَى لَهُ، زَادَ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ فِي عُمْرِهِ‏.‏

Glad tidings for the one who treats his parents kindly; Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, will increase his lifespan.

Al-Adab al-Mufrad, 22

Abu Hurairah (RA) reported that the Prophet (ﷺ) said:

لاَ يَجْزِي وَلَدٌ وَالِدَهُ، إِلاَّ أَنْ يَجِدَهُ مَمْلُوكًا فَيَشْتَرِيَهُ فَيُعْتِقَهُ‏.‏

A son cannot repay his father for what he has done for him, except if he finds him as a slave, then buys him and sets him free

Al-Adab al-Mufrad, 10

It was narrated from Anas that he used to drink from a vessel in three draughts, and Anas said that

وَزَعَمَ أَنَسٌ أَنَّ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ كَانَ يَتَنَفَّسُ فِي الإِنَاءِ ثَلاَثًا ‏.‏

the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to drink from a vessel in three draughts.

Sunan Ibn Majah 3416

Narrated Jundub RA. :The Prophet (ﷺ) said:

مَنْ قَالَ فِي كِتَابِ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ بِرَأْيِهِ فَأَصَابَ فَقَدْ أَخْطَأَ

If anyone interprets the Book of Allah in the light of his opinion even if he is right, he has erred.

Sunan Abi Dawud 3652

Fotnote:

It is not permissible to interpret the Qur’an according to one’s own desires; rather, it is necessary to follow and emulate the explanations of the Sahabah and the Tabi‘in. This is because the interpretations they presented were directly, or indirectly, received from the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), and thus represent the correct explanation. On the other hand, those who interpret the Qur’an based merely on their own understanding cannot produce an explanation equal in authenticity to the aforementioned interpretations.

Narrated AbuHurayrah: The Prophet (ﷺ) said:

مَنْ سُئِلَ عَنْ عِلْمٍ فَكَتَمَهُ أَلْجَمَهُ اللَّهُ بِلِجَامٍ مِنْ نَارٍ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ

He who is asked something he knows and conceals it will have a bridle of fire put on him on the Day of Resurrection.

Sunan Abi Dawud 3658

Narrated AbuHurayrah: The Prophet (ﷺ) said:

مَنْ أَفْتَى بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ كَانَ إِثْمُهُ عَلَى مَنْ أَفْتَاهُ

If anyone is given a legal decision ignorantly, the sin rests on the one who gave it.

Sunan Abi Dawud 3657

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ عِبَادُ الرَّحْمٰنِ الَّذِیْنَ یَمْشُوْنَ عَلَی الْاَرْضِ هَوْنًا وَّ اِذَا خَاطَبَهُمُ الْجٰهِلُوْنَ قَالُوْا سَلٰمًا۝۶۳

And the servants of the Most Merciful are those who walk upon the earth easily, and when the ignorant address them, they say words of peace.

Surah Al-Furqan, v : 63

`Abd Allah bin al-Zubair said on the authority of the father :I asked al-Zubair : What prevents you from narrating traditions from the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) as his Companions narrate from him? He said: By Allah I was very close to him. But I heard him (ﷺ) say:

مَنْ كَذَبَ عَلَىَّ مُتَعَمِّدًا فَلْيَتَبَوَّأْ مَقْعَدَهُ مِنَ النَّارِ

He who lies about me deliberately will certainly come to his abode in Hell.

Sunan Abi Dawud 3651

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ الَّذِیْنَ یَبِیْتُوْنَ لِرَبِّهِمْ سُجَّدًا وَّ قِیَامًا۝۶۴ وَ الَّذِیْنَ یَقُوْلُوْنَ رَبَّنَا اصْرِفْ عَنَّا عَذَابَ جَهَنَّمَ ۖۗ اِنَّ عَذَابَهَا كَانَ غَرَامًاۗۖ۝۶۵

And (Rahman's slaves are) those who spend the night to their Lord prostrating and standing [in prayer]. And those who say, “Our Lord, avert from us the punishment of Jahannam (the Hell); indeed, its punishment is a persisting affliction.”

Surah Al-Furqan, v : 64-65

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ الَّذِیْنَ اِذَاۤ اَنْفَقُوْا لَمْ یُسْرِفُوْا وَ لَمْ یَقْتُرُوْا وَ كَانَ بَیْنَ ذٰلِكَ قَوَامًا۝۶۷

And [Rahman's slaves are] those who, when they spend, do so not excessively or sparingly but are ever, between that, [justly] moderate

Surah Al-Furqan, v : 67

Narrated Abu Hurayrah: The Prophet (ﷺ) said:

مَنْ تَعَلَّمَ عِلْمًا مِمَّا يُبْتَغَى بِهِ وَجْهُ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ لاَ يَتَعَلَّمُهُ إِلاَّ لِيُصِيبَ بِهِ عَرَضًا مِنَ الدُّنْيَا لَمْ يَجِدْ عَرْفَ الْجَنَّةِ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ " . يَعْنِي رِيحَهَا .

If anyone acquires knowledge that should be sought seeking the Face of Allah, but he acquires it only to get some worldly advantage, he will not experience the arf, i.e. the fragrance, of Paradise.

Sunan Abi Dawud 3664

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَالَّذِیۡنَ لَا یَدۡعُوۡنَ مَعَ اللّٰہِ اِلٰـہًا اٰخَرَ وَلَا یَقۡتُلُوۡنَ النَّفۡسَ الَّتِیۡ حَرَّمَ اللّٰہُ اِلَّا بِالۡحَقِّ وَلَا یَزۡنُوۡنَ

And (Rahman's slaves are) those who do not invoke any other god along with Allah, and do not kill a person whom Allah has given sanctity, except rightfully, nor do they commit unlawful sexual intercourse.

Surah Al-Furqan, v : 68

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

یُّضٰعَفۡ لَہُ الۡعَذَابُ یَوۡمَ الۡقِیٰمَۃِ وَیَخۡلُدۡ فِیۡہٖ مُہَانًا

(Whoever worships other gods with Allah, kills a soul unjustly, or commits adultery) the punishment will be doubled for him, and he will remain there disdained, for ever.

Surah Al-Furqan, V : 69

Narrated Abdullah ibn Abbas: The Prophet (ﷺ) said:

تَسْمَعُونَ وَيُسْمَعُ مِنْكُمْ وَيُسْمَعُ مِمَّنْ سَمِعَ مِنْكُمْ

You hear (from me), and others will hear from you; and people will hear from them who heard from you.

Sunan Abi Dawud 3659

Narrated Abu Sa`id Al-Khudri:Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said,

إِذَا سَمِعْتُمُ النِّدَاءَ فَقُولُوا مِثْلَ ما يَقُولُ الْمُؤَذِّنُ

Whenever you hear the Adhan, say what the Mu'adh-dhin is saying.

Sahih al-Bukhari 611

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اِلَّا مَنۡ تَابَ وَاٰمَنَ وَعَمِلَ عَمَلًا صَالِحًا فَاُولٰٓئِکَ یُبَدِّلُ اللّٰہُ سَیِّاٰتِہِمۡ حَسَنٰتٍ ؕ وَکَانَ اللّٰہُ غَفُوۡرًا رَّحِیۡمًا

except the one who repents and believes and does good deeds, then Allah will replace the evils of such people by good deeds, and Allah is Most-Forgiving, Very-Merciful.

Surah Al-Furqan, v : 70

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَالَّذِیۡنَ یَقُوۡلُوۡنَ رَبَّنَا ہَبۡ لَنَا مِنۡ اَزۡوَاجِنَا وَذُرِّیّٰتِنَا قُرَّۃَ اَعۡیُنٍ وَّاجۡعَلۡنَا لِلۡمُتَّقِیۡنَ اِمَامًا

And those who say, "Our Lord, grant us from among our wives and offspring comfort to our eyes and make us an example for the righteous."

Surah Al-Furqan, v : 74

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اُولٰٓىِٕكَ یُجْزَوْنَ الْغُرْفَةَ بِمَا صَبَرُوْا وَ یُلَقَّوْنَ فِیْهَا تَحِیَّةً وَّ سَلٰمًاۙ۝۷۵ خٰلِدِیْنَ فِیْهَا ؕ حَسُنَتْ مُسْتَقَرًّا وَّ مُقَامًا۝۷۶

Those will be awarded with the high place - because they observed patience - and they will be received therein with greetings and [words of] peace. living in it (the Paradise) for ever. It is best as an abode and as a place to dwell in.

Surah Al-Furqan, V : 75-76

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ الَّذِیْنَ لَا یَشْهَدُوْنَ الزُّوْرَ ۙ وَ اِذَا مَرُّوْا بِاللَّغْوِ مَرُّوْا كِرَامًا۝۷۲ وَ الَّذِیْنَ اِذَا ذُكِّرُوْا بِاٰیٰتِ رَبِّهِمْ لَمْ یَخِرُّوْا عَلَیْهَا صُمًّا وَّ عُمْیَانًا

and those who do not witness falsehood, and when they pass by the absurd things, Pass by them with dignity, and those who, when they are reminded of the verses of their Lord, do not fall at them as deaf and blind ones, ‍

Surah Al-Furqan, V : 72-73

Footnote :

The righteous servants of Allah embrace the verses of the Quran with sincere interest. They listen to its message attentively and, with open eyes and ears, strive to understand and internalize the truth to which it draws their attention. (Taqi Usmani)

Abu Hurairah (RA) reported: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said,

يَقْبِضُ اللَّهُ الْأَرْضَ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ وَيَطْوِي السَّمَاءَ بِيَمِينِهِ ثُمَّ يَقُولُ: أَنَا الْمَلِكُ أَيْنَ مُلُوكُ الْأَرْضِ؟

On the Day of Resurrection Allah will grasp the earth in His Hand, and He will roll up the heavens in His Right Hand. Then He will say: ‘I am the King! Where are the kings of the earth?

Sahih al-Bukhari 4812; Sahih Muslim 2787 (23); Sunan Abi Dawud 4732

Narrated Abu Hurayrah (RA): He said, the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

بَادرُوا بِالْأَعْمَالِ فِتناً كَقِطَعِ اللَّيْلِ الْمُظْلِمِ يُصْبِحُ الرَّجُلُ مُؤْمِنًا وَيُمْسِي كَافِرًا وَيُمْسِي مُؤْمِنًا وَيُصْبِحُ كَافِرًا يَبِيعُ دِينَهُ بِعرْض من الدُّنْيَا.

Hasten to perform good deeds before you are overtaken by trials like pieces of a dark night, when a man will wake up as a believer and reach the evening as a disbeliever, or he will reach the evening as a believer and wake up as a disbeliever. He will sell his religion for some worldly gain.

(Sahih Muslim, 186 [118]; Jami‘ at-Tirmidhi, 2195)

Fotnote:

In the mentioned hadith, it has been instructed to hasten in doing righteous deeds before the widespread occurrence of trials (fitan). By fitnah is meant the severe conflicts among Muslims over matters of religion and worldly affairs, leading to killing, looting, clashes, and extreme disagreements. During such times, ordinary Muslims will not be able to perform acts of worship and servitude to Allah in safety.

The severity of these trials will be so intense that within a single day people may lose their faith, from morning to evening or evening to morning. The trials of that time have been likened to the dark night, signifying their mysterious obscurity. Their causes will be difficult to uncover, and finding ways of salvation from them will also become extremely hard.

Narrated Abu Hurayrah (RA): He said, the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

يُسَلِّمُ الصَّغِيرُ عَلَى الْكَبِيرِ وَالْمَارُّ عَلَى الْقَاعِدِ وَالْقَلِيلُ عَلَى الْكَثِيرِ

The younger should greet the elder, the one passing by should greet the one who is sitting, and the smaller group should greet the larger group.

Sahih al-Bukhari, 6231, 6234; Jami‘ at-Tirmidhi, 2704

It was narrated that Nafi' said: I used to send trade goods to Sham and Egypt, then I prepared to send trade goods to 'Iraq. I went to 'Aishah, the Mother of the Believers, and said to her: " O Mother of the Believers I used to send trade goods to Sham and I am preparing to send trade goods to 'Iraq." She said: "Do not do that. What is wrong with the way you have been doing it? I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) say:

إِذَا سَبَّبَ اللَّهُ لأَحَدِكُمْ رِزْقًا مِنْ وَجْهٍ فَلاَ يَدَعْهُ حَتَّى يَتَغَيَّرَ لَهُ أَوْ يَتَنَكَّرَ لَهُ

If Allah causes provision to come to one of you through a certain means, he should not leave it unless it changes or deteriorates.

Mishkat: 2785

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

مَا بَعَثَ اللَّهُ نَبِيًّا إِلاَّ رَاعِيَ غَنَمٍ ‏"‏ ‏.‏ قَالَ لَهُ أَصْحَابُهُ وَأَنْتَ يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ‏.‏ قَالَ ‏"‏ وَأَنَا كُنْتُ أَرْعَاهَا لأَهْلِ مَكَّةَ بِالْقَرَارِيطِ ‏"‏ ‏.‏ قَالَ سُوَيْدٌ يَعْنِي كُلُّ شَاةٍ بِقِيرَاطٍ ‏.‏

Allah has not sent any Prophet but he was a shepherd." His Companions said to him: "Even you, O Messenger of Allah?" He said: "Even me I used to tend the sheep of the people of Makkah for a few Qirats." (Sahih) (One of the narrators) Suwaid said: " Meaning one Qirat for every sheep

Sahihul Bukhari: 2262

Fotnote:

"Qirat" is an Arabic unit of measurement, commonly used for land measurement. It is primarily prevalent in the Middle East and some regions of South Asia.

It was narrated from Ma'mar bin 'Abdullah bin Nadlah that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

لاَ يَحْتَكِرُ إِلاَّ خَاطِئٌ

No one hoards but a sinner.

Muslim: 1605, Tirmiji: 1267

It was narrated from 'Abdullah bin Abu Awfa that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

إِنَّ اللَّهَ مَعَ الْقَاضِي مَا لَمْ يَجُرْ فَإِذَا جَارَ وَكَلَهُ إِلَى نَفْسِهِ

Allah is with the judge so long as he is not unjust, but if he rules unjustly, He entrusts him to himself.

Tirmiji: 1330

It was narrated from 'Abdullah bin 'Amr that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

لَعْنَةُ اللَّهِ عَلَى الرَّاشِي وَالْمُرْتَشِي

The curse of Allah is upon the one who offers a bribe and the one who takes it.

Tirmiji: 1337

It was narrated from 'Amr bin 'As that he heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) say:

إِذَا حَكَمَ الْحَاكِمُ فَاجْتَهَدَ فَأَصَابَ فَلَهُ أَجْرَانِ وَإِذَا حَكَمَ فَاجْتَهَدَ فَأَخْطَأَ فَلَهُ أَجْرٌ

When the judge passes a judgement and does his best and gets it right, he will have two rewards, and if he passes a judgement and does his best and gets it wrong, he will have one reward.

It was narrated from 'Abdul-Malik bin 'Umair that he heard 'Abdur-Rahman bin Abu Bakrah (narrate) from his father that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

لاَ يَقْضِي الْقَاضِي بَيْنَ اثْنَيْنِ وَهُوَ غَضْبَانُ

Let the judge (Qadi) not pass a judgment when he is angry.

Sahihul bukhari: 7158

Abu Huraira reported this directly from the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ):

مَا أَذِنَ اللَّهُ لِشَىْءٍ مَا أَذِنَ لِنَبِيٍّ يَتَغَنَّى بِالْقُرْآنِ ‏"

God has not listened to anything as He listens to a Prophet reciting the Qur'an in a sweet voice.

Sahih Muslim 792

Allah (SWT) says in the Holy Quran

اَلَاۤ اِنَّ اَوْلِیَآءَ اللّٰهِ لَا خَوْفٌ عَلَیْهِمْ وَ لَا هُمْ یَحْزَنُوْنَۚۖ۝۶۲ الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوْا وَ كَانُوْا یَتَّقُوْنَؕ۝۶۳ لَهُمُ الْبُشْرٰی فِی الْحَیٰوةِ الدُّنْیَا وَ فِی الْاٰخِرَةِ ؕ لَا تَبْدِیْلَ لِكَلِمٰتِ اللّٰهِ ؕ ذٰلِكَ هُوَ الْفَوْزُ الْعَظِیْمُؕ۝۶۴

Remember that those who are friends of Allah will have no fear, nor will they grieve. They are those who believe and are God-fearing (possess taqwa). For them are good tidings in the worldly life and in the Hereafter. There is no change in the words of Allah. That is the great success.

Surah Yunus, Verses 62-64

Footnote

No matter how happy a person is in this world, they will always have some fear about the future and some sorrow about the past. However, the friends of Allah will have no such sorrow or fear in Paradise.

The good tidings in the worldly life are received in various ways. For example, angels give them glad tidings at the time of their death, they or others about them are shown good dreams, Allah gives them special help in various matters, and they become well-known and famous among people etc.

[Based on the Bengali translation of Tafsir Tawzeehul Quran]

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah that:the Prophet said:

تُنْكَحُ النِّسَاءُ لِأَرْبَعٍ لِمَالِهَا وَلِحَسَبِهَا وَلِجَمَالِهَا وَلِدِينِهَا فَاظْفَرْ بِذَاتِ الدِّينِ تَرِبَتْ يَدَاكَ

A woman may be married for four things: Her wealth, her lineage, her beauty or for her religion. Choose the religious, may your hands be rubbed with dust (i.e., may you prosper).

Sunan Ibn Majah 1858

Fotnote:

“تَرِبَتْ يَدَاكَ” – Meaning:

The literal meaning is: “May your hands be covered with dust.”

But in Arabic, this expression is used as a form of supplication or strong emphasis. Here, it means—

“If you choose a religious woman, you will be successful.”

Yahya related to me from Malik from Ibn Shihab from Ali ibn Husayn ibn Ali ibn Abi Talib that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said,

Abu Umamah (May Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying,

اقْرَؤُوا القُرْآنَ ؛ فَإِنَّهُ يَأتِي يَوْمَ القِيَامَةِ شَفِيعاً لأَصْحَابِهِ

مَن تَوَضَّأَ فَأَحْسَنَ الوُضُوءَ، خَرَجَتْ خَطَايَاهُ مِنْ جَسَدِهِ حَتَّى تَخْرُج مِنْ تَحْتِ أَظْفَارِه

Muatta Malik: 1887

It was narrated from Samurah that:The Prophet [SAW] said:

الْبَسُوا مِنْ ثِيَابِكُمْ الْبَيَاضَ فَإِنَّهَا أَطْهَرُ وَأَطْيَبُ وَكَفِّنُوا فِيهَا مَوْتَاكُمْ قَالَ يَحْيَى لَمْ أَكْتُبْهُ قُلْتُ لِمَ قَالَ اسْتَغْنَيْتُ بِحَدِيثِ مَيْمُونِ بْنِ أَبِي شَبِيبٍ عَنْ سَمُرَةَ

Wear white garments, for they are purer and better, and shroud your dead in them.

Sunan An Nasai: 3567

In the Holy Quran, Allaays:

فَاِذَا قَضَیْتُمْ مَّنَاسِكَكُمْ فَاذْكُرُوا اللّٰهَ كَذِكْرِكُمْ اٰبَآءَكُمْ اَوْ اَشَدَّ ذِكْرًا ؕ فَمِنَ النَّاسِ مَنْ یَّقُوْلُ رَبَّنَاۤ اٰتِنَا فِی الدُّنْیَا وَ مَا لَهٗ فِی الْاٰخِرَةِ مِنْ خَلَاقٍ۝۲۰۰

When you have completed your pilgrimage, remember Allah as you remember your forefathers, or even more. Some people there are who say (in prayer) only, "Our Lord! Give us good in this world." And they have no share in the Hereafter.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 200

Footnote:

Another custom from the Jahiliyyah (pre-Islamic) era was that after completing the fundamental rituals of Hajj and gathering in Mina, some people would spend an entire day recounting the praises and glories of their forefathers. This verse alludes to that very custom.

Additionally, some people would make supplications, but since they didn't believe in the Hereafter, their prayers were limited to seeking only the blessings of this world. The subsequent part of the verse clarifies that a believer's duty is to seek well-being for both this life and the Hereafter.

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ مِنْهُمْ مَّنْ یَّقُوْلُ رَبَّنَاۤ اٰتِنَا فِی الدُّنْیَا حَسَنَةً وَّ فِی الْاٰخِرَةِ حَسَنَةً وَّ قِنَا عَذَابَ النَّارِ۝۲۰۱

And among them are some who say, "Our Lord! Grant us good in this world and good in the Hereafter, and save us from the punishment of the Fire.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 201

Footnote:

In other words, a discerning believer prays for the welfare of both this world and the Hereafter. This prayer is exceptionally comprehensive.

The good of this world includes things like good health, peace and security, a contented family life, and comfortable sustenance. The good of the Hereafter, on the other hand, includes peace in the grave, an easy reckoning, deliverance from Hellfire, and the attainment of Paradise. Everything is encompassed within this concise supplication. (Tawzihul Quran)

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ مِنَ النَّاسِ مَنْ یَّشْرِیْ نَفْسَهُ ابْتِغَآءَ مَرْضَاتِ اللّٰهِ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ رَءُوْفٌۢ بِالْعِبَادِ۝۲۰۷

And among the people is he who sells himself seeking the pleasure of Allah. And Allah is most compassionate to [His] servants.

Surah: Al-Baqarah
Ayah: 207

Footnote:

This refers to those companions of the Prophet who sacrificed their lives for Islam. The commentators have narrated the stories of several such companions. ‍Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

یٰۤاَیُّهَا الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوا ادْخُلُوْا فِی السِّلْمِ كَآفَّةً ۪ وَّ لَا تَتَّبِعُوْا خُطُوٰتِ الشَّیْطٰنِ ؕ اِنَّهٗ لَكُمْ عَدُوٌّ مُّبِیْنٌ۝۲۰۸

O you who have believed, enter into Islam completely, and do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.

Surah: Al-Baqarah
Ayah: 208

Footnote:

Some of the Jews who converted to Islam wanted to continue practicing certain rituals of Judaism as before. In response, this verse was revealed. It was an instruction to enter Islam completely, in mind, body, thought, belief, and action. The guidance given to you in the Quran and Sunnah is sufficient for you. Therefore, follow only that. Completely abandon the mental weakness of adopting anything from other religions or ideologies, or following fabricated customs, innovations (bid'ah), superstitions, and the like. Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

هَلْ یَنْظُرُوْنَ اِلَّاۤ اَنْ یَّاْتِیَهُمُ اللّٰهُ فِیْ ظُلَلٍ مِّنَ الْغَمَامِ وَ الْمَلٰٓىِٕكَةُ وَ قُضِیَ الْاَمْرُ ؕ وَ اِلَی اللّٰهِ تُرْجَعُ الْاُمُوْرُ۠۝۲۱۰

Are they waiting for anything other than that Allah should come to them in the shadows of the clouds, and the angels, and the matter is decided? And to Allah all matters are returned.

Footnote :

Various disbelievers, especially the Jews of Medina, used to make such demands: "Why doesn't Allah Himself appear directly before our eyes and command us to believe?" This verse is a response to that. The gist of the reply is that this world is essentially a place of trial. The test is whether a person uses their intellect and judgment, and based on the clear signs scattered throughout the universe, comes to believe in the oneness of Allah (Tawheed) and the messengership of the Prophets. For this reason, true value in this test lies in belief in the unseen (Ghayb). If Allah were to be seen directly, where would the test be? It is a principle of Allah that if a person sees the unseen things with their own eyes, their belief is no longer acceptable. That is why the unseen things are not made visible. However, when this world is brought to an end and the time for punishment and reward arrives, some of the unseen things will be shown with the naked eye. The phrase "the matter is decided" in the verse refers to this.
Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

۠۝۲۱۰ سَلْ بَنِیْۤ اِسْرَآءِیْلَ كَمْ اٰتَیْنٰهُمْ مِّنْ اٰیَةٍۭ بَیِّنَةٍ ؕ وَ مَنْ یُّبَدِّلْ نِعْمَةَ اللّٰهِ مِنْۢ بَعْدِ مَا جَآءَتْهُ فَاِنَّ اللّٰهَ شَدِیْدُ الْعِقَابِ۝۲۱۱

Ask the Children of Israel how many clear signs We gave them. And whoever changes the favor of Allah after it has come to him - then indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.

Footnote :

The "favor of Allah" refers to His signs. In essence, these are a great blessing from Allah, as they are a means of salvation from misguidance and a cause for guidance. The Children of Israel altered this by turning what Allah had revealed as a means of guidance into a cause for their own deviation. Alternatively, it means that they altered and distorted the verses in their scriptures that spoke about the truthfulness of the Great Prophet (peace be upon him) and his religion. Furthermore, changing a favor can also mean showing ingratitude for a favor. The Jews were ungrateful for the favors bestowed by Allah at every turn, as has been described in various places in this Surah and will also be mentioned in other Surahs to come.
Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

كَانَ النَّاسُ اُمَّةً وَّاحِدَةً ۫ فَبَعَثَ اللّٰهُ النَّبِیّٖنَ مُبَشِّرِیْنَ وَ مُنْذِرِیْنَ ۪ وَ اَنْزَلَ مَعَهُمُ الْكِتٰبَ بِالْحَقِّ لِیَحْكُمَ بَیْنَ النَّاسِ فِیْمَا اخْتَلَفُوْا فِیْهِ ؕ وَ مَا اخْتَلَفَ فِیْهِ اِلَّا الَّذِیْنَ اُوْتُوْهُ مِنْۢ بَعْدِ مَا جَآءَتْهُمُ الْبَیِّنٰتُ بَغْیًۢا بَیْنَهُمْ ۚ فَهَدَی اللّٰهُ الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوْا لِمَا اخْتَلَفُوْا فِیْهِ مِنَ الْحَقِّ بِاِذْنِهٖ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ یَهْدِیْ مَنْ یَّشَآءُ اِلٰی صِرَاطٍ مُّسْتَقِیْمٍ۝۲۱۳

(Initially) All people were followers of a single religion. Then (when differences arose among them) Allah sent the prophets as bearers of good news (for the righteous) and as warners (for the liars). And He sent down with them the Book containing the truth, so that it might judge between people concerning the matters in which they differed. And it was no one else but those to whom the Book was given who differed in it (in that very Book), after the clear signs had come to them, only due to mutual envy. Then Allah guided the believers to the truth concerning the matter in which they differed, by His will. And Allah guides whom He wills to a straight path.

Surah: Al-Baqarah
Ayah: 213

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اَمْ حَسِبْتُمْ اَنْ تَدْخُلُوا الْجَنَّةَ وَ لَمَّا یَاْتِكُمْ مَّثَلُ الَّذِیْنَ خَلَوْا مِنْ قَبْلِكُمْ ؕ مَسَّتْهُمُ الْبَاْسَآءُ وَ الضَّرَّآءُ وَ زُلْزِلُوْا حَتّٰی یَقُوْلَ الرَّسُوْلُ وَ الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوْا مَعَهٗ مَتٰی نَصْرُ اللّٰهِ ؕ اَلَاۤ اِنَّ نَصْرَ اللّٰهِ قَرِیْبٌ۝۲۱۴

Do you think that you will enter Paradise while such [trials] have not yet come to you as came to those who passed on before you? They were touched by poverty and hardship, and they were shaken until [even] the Messenger and those who believed with him said, "When is the help of Allah?" Unquestionably, the help of Allah is near.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 214

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

یَسْـَٔلُوْنَكَ مَا ذَا یُنْفِقُوْنَ ؕ۬ قُلْ مَاۤ اَنْفَقْتُمْ مِّنْ خَیْرٍ فَلِلْوَالِدَیْنِ وَ الْاَقْرَبِیْنَ وَ الْیَتٰمٰی وَ الْمَسٰكِیْنِ وَ ابْنِ السَّبِیْلِ ؕ وَ مَا تَفْعَلُوْا مِنْ خَیْرٍ فَاِنَّ اللّٰهَ بِهٖ عَلِیْمٌ۝۲۱۵

They ask you, [O Muhammad], what they should spend. Say, "Whatever you spend of good is [due] to parents and relatives and orphans and the needy and the traveler. And whatever you do of good - indeed, Allah is Knowing of it.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 215

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

كُتِبَ عَلَیْكُمُ الْقِتَالُ وَ هُوَ كُرْهٌ لَّكُمْ ۚ وَ عَسٰۤی اَنْ تَكْرَهُوْا شَیْـًٔا وَّ هُوَ خَیْرٌ لَّكُمْ ۚ وَ عَسٰۤی اَنْ تُحِبُّوْا شَیْـًٔا وَّ هُوَ شَرٌّ لَّكُمْ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ یَعْلَمُ وَ اَنْتُمْ لَا تَعْلَمُوْنَ۠۝۲۱۶

Fighting has been enjoined upon you, though it is disliked by you. But it is possible that you dislike a thing which is good for you, and it is possible that you like a thing which is bad for you. And Allah knows, while you know not.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 216

Footnote :

What wonderful guidance! Keeping this lesson alive in one's thoughts and consciousness can make life very peaceful. Many times, people adopt a plan and try to implement it, but if for some reason it fails, they get depressed and fall into despair. Other times, something seems unpleasant to a person, and they make every effort to avoid it, but in reality, their efforts fail, and they ultimately have to face it. At that time too, they break down. Allah says that you do not know what is truly good or bad for you; only Allah knows. What you desire in reality might be a cause of sorrow for you, and what you dislike might bring immense benefits. Therefore, you should leave the decision to Allah. Obey His commands and prohibitions with all your heart and be content with what happens according to destiny. Many times, true benefit is hidden from your sight, so you don't understand it. Even if you don't understand, the benefit itself is what matters. At the very least, you can find solace in the fact that for the patience you show when your desired things are not achieved and undesired things occur, there will be a great reward in the Hereafter. Therefore, keep this core principle in mind in every aspect of life, including Jihad.

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

یَسْـَٔلُوْنَكَ عَنِ الشَّهْرِ الْحَرَامِ قِتَالٍ فِیْهِ ؕ قُلْ قِتَالٌ فِیْهِ كَبِیْرٌ ؕ وَ صَدٌّ عَنْ سَبِیْلِ اللّٰهِ وَ كُفْرٌۢ بِهٖ وَ الْمَسْجِدِ الْحَرَامِ ۗ وَ اِخْرَاجُ اَهْلِهٖ مِنْهُ اَكْبَرُ عِنْدَ اللّٰهِ ۚ وَ الْفِتْنَةُ اَكْبَرُ مِنَ الْقَتْلِ ؕ وَ لَا یَزَالُوْنَ یُقَاتِلُوْنَكُمْ حَتّٰی یَرُدُّوْكُمْ عَنْ دِیْنِكُمْ اِنِ اسْتَطَاعُوْا ؕ وَ مَنْ یَّرْتَدِدْ مِنْكُمْ عَنْ دِیْنِهٖ فَیَمُتْ وَ هُوَ كَافِرٌ فَاُولٰٓىِٕكَ حَبِطَتْ اَعْمَالُهُمْ فِی الدُّنْیَا وَ الْاٰخِرَةِ ۚ وَ اُولٰٓىِٕكَ اَصْحٰبُ النَّارِ ۚ هُمْ فِیْهَا خٰلِدُوْنَ۝۲۱۷

They ask you about the sacred month - about fighting therein. Say, "Fighting therein is a great sin, but averting [people] from the way of Allah, and disbelief in Him, and [preventing access to] the Masjid al-Haram, and expelling its people from it are greater [sins] in the sight of Allah. And fitnah is worse than killing. And they will continue to fight you until they turn you back from your religion, if they are able. And whoever among you reverts from his religion and dies while he is a disbeliever - for those, their deeds have become worthless in this world and the Hereafter, and those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 217

Footnote :

In Surah At-Tawbah (9:36), four months are designated as 'Ashhur-e-Hurum' or the sacred months. The Prophet (peace be upon him) explained that these four months are Rajab, Dhul-Qa'dah, Dhul-Hijjah, and Muharram. Fighting is prohibited during these months. However, if an enemy attacks during this time, self-defense is permissible.

Once, during a journey, a clash occurred between a group of polytheists and some companions of the Prophet. A polytheist named Amr ibn al-Hadrami was killed by the Muslims. This incident took place on the evening of the 29th of Jumada al-Ukhra, but the month of Rajab began right after his death. The polytheists used this incident to launch a storm of criticism against the Muslims. They claimed that the Muslims had no respect for the sacred months. In response to their propaganda, the verse was revealed.

The essence of what the verse states is that, firstly, the killing of Amr ibn al-Hadrami happened based on a misunderstanding; he was not killed knowingly in a sacred month. Yet, those who started this storm of criticism have committed even greater sins. They not only prevent people from entering the Masjid al-Haram but also oppress those who are truly deserving of worshiping there, making their lives miserable and forcing them to flee. Furthermore, they have adopted the practice of disbelief in Allah.
Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اِنَّ الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوْا وَ الَّذِیْنَ هَاجَرُوْا وَ جٰهَدُوْا فِیْ سَبِیْلِ اللّٰهِ ۙ اُولٰٓىِٕكَ یَرْجُوْنَ رَحْمَتَ اللّٰهِ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ غَفُوْرٌ رَّحِیْمٌ۝۲۱۸

Indeed, those who have believed and those who have emigrated and fought in the cause of Allah - those expect the mercy of Allah. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 218

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

یَسْـَٔلُوْنَكَ عَنِ الْخَمْرِ وَ الْمَیْسِرِ ؕ قُلْ فِیْهِمَاۤ اِثْمٌ كَبِیْرٌ وَّ مَنَافِعُ لِلنَّاسِ ؗ وَ اِثْمُهُمَاۤ اَكْبَرُ مِنْ نَّفْعِهِمَا ؕ وَ یَسْـَٔلُوْنَكَ مَا ذَا یُنْفِقُوْنَ ؕ۬ قُلِ الْعَفْوَ ؕ كَذٰلِكَ یُبَیِّنُ اللّٰهُ لَكُمُ الْاٰیٰتِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَتَفَكَّرُوْنَۙ۝۲۱۹

They ask you about wine and gambling. Say, "In them is great sin and [yet, some] benefit for people. But their sin is greater than their benefit." And they ask you what they should spend. Say, "The excess [beyond your needs]." Thus Allah makes clear to you the verses so that you might give thought.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 219

Footnote :

It is narrated from some companions that after hearing about the rewards of charity, they gave away their entire savings as sadaqah, leaving nothing for themselves or their families. As a result, their family members went hungry. This verse clarifies that the correct form of charity is what is given after fulfilling the necessary needs of oneself and one's family. Therefore, the Prophet (peace be upon him) emphasized in various hadiths that the amount of charity should be such that one's family does not become dependent on others.
Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

فِی الدُّنْیَا وَ الْاٰخِرَةِ ؕ وَ یَسْـَٔلُوْنَكَ عَنِ الْیَتٰمٰی ؕ قُلْ اِصْلَاحٌ لَّهُمْ خَیْرٌ ؕ وَ اِنْ تُخَالِطُوْهُمْ فَاِخْوَانُكُمْ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ یَعْلَمُ الْمُفْسِدَ مِنَ الْمُصْلِحِ ؕ وَ لَوْ شَآءَ اللّٰهُ لَاَعْنَتَكُمْ ؕ اِنَّ اللّٰهَ عَزِیْزٌ حَكِیْمٌ۝۲۲۰

[They ask] about this world and the Hereafter. And they ask you about orphans. Say, "Improvement for them is best. And if you mix with them, they are your brothers. And Allah knows the corrupter from the reformer. And if Allah had willed, He could have put you in difficulty. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise."

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 220

Footnote :

When the Quran issued severe warnings about devouring the property of orphans (Surah An-Nisa 4:2, 10), the companions who were in charge of orphans began to exercise extreme caution with them. They even started cooking food for the orphans separately and feeding them separately. As a result, if some of their food was left over, it would go to waste. This caused both more difficulty and loss. This verse clarifies that the main objective is to look after the welfare of the orphans, not to put their guardians in difficulty. Therefore, there is no harm in cooking their food together and eating together. The condition is that their food expenses must be taken from their property with justice and fairness. If there is an unintentional slight discrepancy, it is forgivable. However, one must not knowingly cause them harm. Allah knows well who acts with justice and welfare and who has ill intentions.
Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

۝۲۲۰ وَ لَا تَنْكِحُوا الْمُشْرِكٰتِ حَتّٰی یُؤْمِنَّ ؕ وَ لَاَمَةٌ مُّؤْمِنَةٌ خَیْرٌ مِّنْ مُّشْرِكَةٍ وَّ لَوْ اَعْجَبَتْكُمْ ۚ وَ لَا تُنْكِحُوا الْمُشْرِكِیْنَ حَتّٰی یُؤْمِنُوْا ؕ وَ لَعَبْدٌ مُّؤْمِنٌ خَیْرٌ مِّنْ مُّشْرِكٍ وَّ لَوْ اَعْجَبَكُمْ ؕ اُولٰٓىِٕكَ یَدْعُوْنَ اِلَی النَّارِ ۖۚ وَ اللّٰهُ یَدْعُوْۤا اِلَی الْجَنَّةِ وَ الْمَغْفِرَةِ بِاِذْنِهٖ ۚ وَ یُبَیِّنُ اٰیٰتِهٖ لِلنَّاسِ لَعَلَّهُمْ یَتَذَكَّرُوْنَ۠۝۲۲۱

And do not marry polytheistic women until they believe. And a believing slave woman is better than a polytheist, even though she might please you. And do not give your women in marriage to polytheistic men until they believe. And a believing slave is better than a polytheist, even though he might please you. Those invite to the Fire, but Allah invites to Paradise and to forgiveness, by His permission. And He makes clear His verses to the people that they may remember.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 221

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

۝۲۲۰ وَ لَا تَنْكِحُوا الْمُشْرِكٰتِ حَتّٰی یُؤْمِنَّ ؕ وَ لَاَمَةٌ مُّؤْمِنَةٌ خَیْرٌ مِّنْ مُّشْرِكَةٍ وَّ لَوْ اَعْجَبَتْكُمْ ۚ وَ لَا تُنْكِحُوا الْمُشْرِكِیْنَ حَتّٰی یُؤْمِنُوْا ؕ وَ لَعَبْدٌ مُّؤْمِنٌ خَیْرٌ مِّنْ مُّشْرِكٍ وَّ لَوْ اَعْجَبَكُمْ ؕ اُولٰٓىِٕكَ یَدْعُوْنَ اِلَی النَّارِ ۖۚ وَ اللّٰهُ یَدْعُوْۤا اِلَی الْجَنَّةِ وَ الْمَغْفِرَةِ بِاِذْنِهٖ ۚ وَ یُبَیِّنُ اٰیٰتِهٖ لِلنَّاسِ لَعَلَّهُمْ یَتَذَكَّرُوْنَ۠۝۲۲۱

And do not marry polytheistic women until they believe. And a believing slave woman is better than a polytheist, even though she might please you. And do not give your women in marriage to polytheistic men until they believe. And a believing slave is better than a polytheist, even though he might please you. Those invite to the Fire, but Allah invites to Paradise and to forgiveness, by His permission. And He makes clear His verses to the people that they may remember.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 221

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ یَسْـَٔلُوْنَكَ عَنِ الْمَحِیْضِ ؕ قُلْ هُوَ اَذًی ۙ فَاعْتَزِلُوا النِّسَآءَ فِی الْمَحِیْضِ ۙ وَ لَا تَقْرَبُوْهُنَّ حَتّٰی یَطْهُرْنَ ۚ فَاِذَا تَطَهَّرْنَ فَاْتُوْهُنَّ مِنْ حَیْثُ اَمَرَكُمُ اللّٰهُ ؕ اِنَّ اللّٰهَ یُحِبُّ التَّوَّابِیْنَ وَ یُحِبُّ الْمُتَطَهِّرِیْنَ۝۲۲۲

And they ask you about menstruation. Say, "It is an ailment, so keep away from women during menstruation and do not approach them until they are purified." But when they have purified themselves, then come to them from where Allah has ordered you. Indeed, Allah loves those who are constantly repentant and loves those who purify themselves.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 222

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 222

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ لَا تَجْعَلُوا اللّٰهَ عُرْضَةً لِّاَیْمَانِكُمْ اَنْ تَبَرُّوْا وَ تَتَّقُوْا وَ تُصْلِحُوْا بَیْنَ النَّاسِ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ سَمِیْعٌ عَلِیْمٌ۝۲۲۴

And do not make [your oath by] Allah an excuse in your oaths against doing good, being righteous, and making peace among people. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 224

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

لَا یُؤَاخِذُكُمُ اللّٰهُ بِاللَّغْوِ فِیْۤ اَیْمَانِكُمْ وَ لٰكِنْ یُّؤَاخِذُكُمْ بِمَا كَسَبَتْ قُلُوْبُكُمْ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ غَفُوْرٌ حَلِیْمٌ۝۲۲۵

Allah will not impose blame upon you for what is unintentional in your oaths, but He will impose blame upon you for what your hearts have intended. And Allah is Forgiving and Forbearing.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 225

There are two types of 'unintentional oaths' (laghw qasam). The first is an oath that is not made with the intention of swearing; rather, it is a phrase that slips from the tongue as a common expression, especially among Arabs who would often say "wa Allah" (by Allah) casually. The second type of laghw is an oath a person sometimes makes about a past event, believing it to be true with no intention of lying, but later discovers that what they swore was not actually correct. Both of these types of oaths are called 'laghw'. This verse indicates that there is no sin in these kinds of oaths. However, people should be cautious about swearing and try to avoid even these types of oaths.
Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

لِلَّذِیْنَ یُؤْلُوْنَ مِنْ نِّسَآىِٕهِمْ تَرَبُّصُ اَرْبَعَةِ اَشْهُرٍ ۚ فَاِنْ فَآءُوْ فَاِنَّ اللّٰهَ غَفُوْرٌ رَّحِیْمٌ۝۲۲۶

For those who swear not to have sexual relations with their wives is a waiting period of four months, so if they return [to normal relations] - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

Footnote :

Among the Arabs, an unjust practice was common where a man would swear an oath not to go to his wife. As a result, the wife would be left in a suspended state for an indefinite period; she would neither get her marital rights nor could she marry someone else. Such an oath is called 'ila'.

This verse has legislated that a person who takes an oath of 'ila' has a grace period of four months to break the oath, pay the expiation, and restore normal marital relations with his wife. If he fails to do so, their marriage will be annulled. The meaning of the next verse, which says, "And if they decide on divorce," is that if he does not break the oath within the four months and lets the term expire, the marriage will automatically be terminated.
Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ الْمُطَلَّقٰتُ یَتَرَبَّصْنَ بِاَنْفُسِهِنَّ ثَلٰثَةَ قُرُوْٓءٍ ؕ وَ لَا یَحِلُّ لَهُنَّ اَنْ یَّكْتُمْنَ مَا خَلَقَ اللّٰهُ فِیْۤ اَرْحَامِهِنَّ اِنْ كُنَّ یُؤْمِنَّ بِاللّٰهِ وَ الْیَوْمِ الْاٰخِرِ ؕ وَ بُعُوْلَتُهُنَّ اَحَقُّ بِرَدِّهِنَّ فِیْ ذٰلِكَ اِنْ اَرَادُوْۤا اِصْلَاحًا ؕ وَ لَهُنَّ مِثْلُ الَّذِیْ عَلَیْهِنَّ بِالْمَعْرُوْفِ ۪ وَ لِلرِّجَالِ عَلَیْهِنَّ دَرَجَةٌ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ عَزِیْزٌ حَكِیْمٌ۠۝۲۲۸

Divorced women must wait three menstrual cycles by themselves. It is not lawful for them to conceal what Allah has created in their wombs, if they believe in Allah and the Last Day. Their husbands have a greater right to take them back during this period, if they desire reconciliation. And due to them is a right similar to what is expected of them, according to what is reasonable. But the men have a degree over them. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 228, Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

Footnote :

During the age of ignorance (Jahiliyyah), women had no recognized rights. This verse makes it clear that both husband and wife have rights over one another. However, it is undeniable that in life, Allah has made the husband the maintainer and protector, as is explicitly stated in Surah An-Nisa (4:34). In this respect, he has one degree of superiority.

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اَلطَّلَاقُ مَرَّتٰنِ ۪ فَاِمْسَاكٌۢ بِمَعْرُوْفٍ اَوْ تَسْرِیْحٌۢ بِاِحْسَانٍ ؕ وَ لَا یَحِلُّ لَكُمْ اَنْ تَاْخُذُوْا مِمَّاۤ اٰتَیْتُمُوْهُنَّ شَیْـًٔا اِلَّاۤ اَنْ یَّخَافَاۤ اَلَّا یُقِیْمَا حُدُوْدَ اللّٰهِ ؕ فَاِنْ خِفْتُمْ اَلَّا یُقِیْمَا حُدُوْدَ اللّٰهِ ۙ فَلَا جُنَاحَ عَلَیْهِمَا فِیْمَا افْتَدَتْ بِهٖ ؕ تِلْكَ حُدُوْدُ اللّٰهِ فَلَا تَعْتَدُوْهَا ۚ وَ مَنْ یَّتَعَدَّ حُدُوْدَ اللّٰهِ فَاُولٰٓىِٕكَ هُمُ الظّٰلِمُوْنَ۝۲۲۹

Divorce is [permissible] two times. After that, [the husband must choose:] either retention with righteousness or a graceful release. And it is not lawful for you [husbands] to take anything of what you have given them, unless both parties fear that they will not be able to keep within the limits of Allah. So if you fear that they will not be able to keep within the limits of Allah, then there is no blame upon either of them for what the wife gives back for her redemption. These are the limits of Allah, so do not transgress them. And whoever transgresses the limits of Allah - it is those who are the wrongdoers.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 229

Footnote :

In this verse, one instruction given is that if divorce must occur, it should be a maximum of two divorces. This is because in this state, there is an opportunity to maintain the relationship between the husband and wife, as the husband has the right to revoke the divorce during the waiting period (iddah). After the waiting period, they can remarry with mutual consent and a new dowry. However, if three divorces are given, both of these paths are closed, as stated in the following verse. In that case, there is no way left to restore the relationship.

The second instruction is that whether the husband decides to revoke the divorce or to end the relationship, the matter should be completed beautifully and with good conduct. In normal circumstances, it is not permissible for the husband to demand the return or waiver of the dowry in exchange for the divorce. However, if the wife herself asks for the divorce, and it is not due to any oppression from the husband, but for some other reason—for example, the wife dislikes the husband, and because of this, they both fear they will not be able to comfortably fulfill their marital duties—then in this situation, it is permissible for the wife to return the full dowry or a part of it, or to waive it if it has not yet been paid (this is technically called 'khula').

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

فَاِنْ طَلَّقَهَا فَلَا تَحِلُّ لَهٗ مِنْۢ بَعْدُ حَتّٰی تَنْكِحَ زَوْجًا غَیْرَهٗ ؕ فَاِنْ طَلَّقَهَا فَلَا جُنَاحَ عَلَیْهِمَاۤ اَنْ یَّتَرَاجَعَاۤ اِنْ ظَنَّاۤ اَنْ یُّقِیْمَا حُدُوْدَ اللّٰهِ ؕ وَ تِلْكَ حُدُوْدُ اللّٰهِ یُبَیِّنُهَا لِقَوْمٍ یَّعْلَمُوْنَ۝۲۳۰

And if he has divorced her [for the third time], then she is not lawful to him afterward until she marries another husband. And if he [the second husband] divorces her, there is no blame upon them for returning to one another if they think that they can keep within the limits of Allah. And those are the limits of Allah, which He makes clear to a people who know.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 230

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ اِذَا طَلَّقْتُمُ النِّسَآءَ فَبَلَغْنَ اَجَلَهُنَّ فَاَمْسِكُوْهُنَّ بِمَعْرُوْفٍ اَوْ سَرِّحُوْهُنَّ بِمَعْرُوْفٍ ۪ وَّ لَا تُمْسِكُوْهُنَّ ضِرَارًا لِّتَعْتَدُوْا ۚ وَ مَنْ یَّفْعَلْ ذٰلِكَ فَقَدْ ظَلَمَ نَفْسَهٗ ؕ وَ لَا تَتَّخِذُوْۤا اٰیٰتِ اللّٰهِ هُزُوًا ؗ وَّ اذْكُرُوْا نِعْمَتَ اللّٰهِ عَلَیْكُمْ وَ مَاۤ اَنْزَلَ عَلَیْكُمْ مِّنَ الْكِتٰبِ وَ الْحِكْمَةِ یَعِظُكُمْ بِهٖ ؕ وَ اتَّقُوا اللّٰهَ وَ اعْلَمُوْۤا اَنَّ اللّٰهَ بِكُلِّ شَیْءٍ عَلِیْمٌ۠۝۲۳۱

And when you divorce women and they have almost fulfilled their term, then either retain them with righteousness or release them with righteousness. And do not retain them in order to harm them, so that you may transgress. And whoever does that has certainly wronged himself. And do not take the verses of Allah as a mockery. And remember the favor of Allah upon you and what He has sent down to you of the Book and wisdom by which He instructs you. And fear Allah and know that Allah is Knowing of all things.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 231

Footnote :

The legal provisions given in the verse, such as marriage, divorce, 'ila', and 'khula', are extremely significant and beneficial. Therefore, do not use them for trickery or with malicious intent, such as taking a wife back after divorce with the intention of tormenting her. Or saying after a marriage, "My intention was not to marry, I was just having fun," or after a divorce, "I was just kidding." Doing so is tantamount to mocking the verses. So, abandon such methods and follow Allah's verses with a sincere heart. There is a Hadith that says three things, even if done in jest, become real: marriage, divorce, and raj'at (taking a wife back after a divorce).
Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ اِذَا طَلَّقْتُمُ النِّسَآءَ فَبَلَغْنَ اَجَلَهُنَّ فَلَا تَعْضُلُوْهُنَّ اَنْ یَّنْكِحْنَ اَزْوَاجَهُنَّ اِذَا تَرَاضَوْا بَیْنَهُمْ بِالْمَعْرُوْفِ ؕ ذٰلِكَ یُوْعَظُ بِهٖ مَنْ كَانَ مِنْكُمْ یُؤْمِنُ بِاللّٰهِ وَ الْیَوْمِ الْاٰخِرِ ؕ ذٰلِكُمْ اَزْكٰی لَكُمْ وَ اَطْهَرُ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ یَعْلَمُ وَ اَنْتُمْ لَا تَعْلَمُوْنَ۝۲۳۲

This is an admonition for whoever among you believes in Allah and the Last Day. That is more virtuous and purer for you. And Allah knows, while you know not.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 232

Footnote :

Many times, after a divorce and the completion of the waiting period, both the husband and wife would learn a lesson. As a result, they would want to start a new life and remarry each other. Since the divorce was not a third divorce, a new marriage was legally permissible in the Shariah, and the wife was also willing. However, her relatives, due to their false pride, would prevent her from remarrying her former husband. This verse invalidates their mistaken tradition.
Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ الْوَالِدٰتُ یُرْضِعْنَ اَوْلَادَهُنَّ حَوْلَیْنِ كَامِلَیْنِ لِمَنْ اَرَادَ اَنْ یُّتِمَّ الرَّضَاعَةَ ؕ وَ عَلَی الْمَوْلُوْدِ لَهٗ رِزْقُهُنَّ وَ كِسْوَتُهُنَّ بِالْمَعْرُوْفِ ؕ لَا تُكَلَّفُ نَفْسٌ اِلَّا وُسْعَهَا ۚ لَا تُضَآرَّ وَالِدَةٌۢ بِوَلَدِهَا وَ لَا مَوْلُوْدٌ لَّهٗ بِوَلَدِهٖ ۗ وَ عَلَی الْوَارِثِ مِثْلُ ذٰلِكَ ۚ فَاِنْ اَرَادَا فِصَالًا عَنْ تَرَاضٍ مِّنْهُمَا وَ تَشَاوُرٍ فَلَا جُنَاحَ عَلَیْهِمَا ؕ وَ اِنْ اَرَدْتُّمْ اَنْ تَسْتَرْضِعُوْۤا اَوْلَادَكُمْ فَلَا جُنَاحَ عَلَیْكُمْ اِذَا سَلَّمْتُمْ مَّاۤ اٰتَیْتُمْ بِالْمَعْرُوْفِ ؕ وَ اتَّقُوا اللّٰهَ وَ اعْلَمُوْۤا اَنَّ اللّٰهَ بِمَا تَعْمَلُوْنَ بَصِیْرٌ۝۲۳۳

Mothers shall nurse their children for two full years - for those who wish to complete the nursing term. It is the duty of the father to provide for them and clothe them in a just manner. No soul is burdened beyond its capacity. A mother shall not be harmed through her child, nor a father through his child. And a similar duty is incumbent upon the heir. If they both desire weaning by mutual consent and consultation, there is no blame upon them. And if you wish to have your children nursed by a wet nurse, there is no blame upon you as long as you pay what you agreed upon in a just manner. And fear Allah and know that Allah is all-seeing of what you do.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 233

Footnote :

The topic of breastfeeding a child has been mentioned in the middle of the divorce regulations because this issue can also become a source of conflict between parents. However, the rulings described here are not limited to divorce; they are generally applicable in all situations.

Firstly, this section clarifies that the maximum period for breastfeeding is two years. After this, it is necessary to wean the child off breast milk. Secondly, it is stated that if both parents agree and believe it is better for the child, they can wean the child even before the two-year period is complete. Completing the two years is not obligatory. The third point is that the father of the child must bear the living expenses of the mother who is breastfeeding. If the marriage is still intact, this is an obligation due to the marriage itself. If a divorce has occurred, the mother is obligated to breastfeed the child during her waiting period (iddah), and the divorced husband must bear her expenses. After the iddah period, even if she does not receive maintenance, the divorced mother can demand payment for breastfeeding.
Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

And those of you who die and leave wives behind - they shall wait by themselves for four months and ten days. And when they have fulfilled their term, there is no blame upon you for what they do with themselves in a reasonable manner. And Allah is fully aware of what you do.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 234

There is no blame upon you for what you allude to concerning a proposal to women or what you conceal within yourselves. Allah knows that you will be thinking of them, but do not promise them secretly except for saying a proper statement. And do not determine to consummate the marriage contract until the prescribed period reaches its end. And know that Allah knows what is in your souls, so be wary of Him. And know that Allah is Forgiving and Forbearing.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 235

Footnote :

It is completely forbidden to propose marriage directly to a woman observing her waiting period (iddah) or to finalize an agreement with her that she will marry you after her iddah ends. However, the verse permits making veiled hints that allow the woman to understand that the person intends to propose after her waiting period. For example, a person can simply say, "I am also looking for a suitable spouse."
Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

There is no blame upon you if you divorce women before you have touched them or specified for them an obligation (i.e., a dowry). But provide for them a gift - upon the wealthy according to his capacity and upon the poor according to his capacity - a provision in a just manner, a duty upon the doers of good.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 236

Footnote :

If the husband and wife do not set a dowry at the time of marriage, and they divorce before they have a chance for a private meeting, then in this situation, the husband is not obligated to pay the dowry. However, it is mandatory to give at least one pair of clothes. Giving some additional gifts is even better. (In Islamic jurisprudence, this gift is called 'mut'ah'.) If a dowry was agreed upon at the time of marriage, and then the divorce occurs before any private meeting, then half of the dowry must be paid.
Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

And if you divorce them before you have touched them and you have already specified for them an obligation (i.e., a dowry), then [give them] half of what you have specified unless they waive it or the one in whose hand is the marriage contract (i.e., the husband) waives it. And if you [the husbands] waive it, it is closer to righteousness. And do not forget the generosity among yourselves. Indeed, Allah is all-seeing of what you do.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 237

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

حٰفِظُوْا عَلَی الصَّلَوٰتِ وَ الصَّلٰوةِ الْوُسْطٰی ۗ وَ قُوْمُوْا لِلّٰهِ قٰنِتِیْنَ۝۲۳۸

Maintain with care the prayers and [in particular] the middle prayer, and stand before Allah with devout submission.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 238

Footnote :

The description of Islamic beliefs and rulings that began with verse 153 (see our commentary on that verse) is now coming to an end. That description started with an emphasis on prayer (Salat) in verse 153. Now, in the conclusion, the importance of prayer is reiterated. It is stated that even in difficult circumstances of war, one must be mindful of prayer to the greatest extent possible.

The "middle prayer" refers to the 'Asr prayer. The reason for its special emphasis is that people are usually busy with their work and affairs during this time, so there is a high possibility of being negligent about performing the prayer.
Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ لِلْمُطَلَّقٰتِ مَتَاعٌۢ بِالْمَعْرُوْفِ ؕ حَقًّا عَلَی الْمُتَّقِیْنَ۝۲۴۱

And for divorced women is a provision in a just manner - a duty upon the righteous.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 241

Footnote :

The command to provide "benefit" to divorced women is very comprehensive. It includes maintenance during the waiting period (iddah) as well as the payment of the dowry if it has not yet been paid. Additionally, the gift mentioned in verse 236 is also included in this.

If no dowry was specified at the time of marriage and the divorce occurs before any private meeting, then giving a gift is obligatory. However, if a dowry was agreed upon, giving a gift is not obligatory but is recommended (mustahab). Therefore, she should be given some gift in addition to her dowry.

These rulings make it clear that divorce is not a good thing. It should only be considered when no other option remains. When a divorce is given, the termination of the marital relationship should be done in a respectable, generous, and dignified manner, in a calm and composed environment, not in a hostile one.
Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اَلَمْ تَرَ اِلَی الَّذِیْنَ خَرَجُوْا مِنْ دِیَارِهِمْ وَ هُمْ اُلُوْفٌ حَذَرَ الْمَوْتِ ۪ فَقَالَ لَهُمُ اللّٰهُ مُوْتُوْا ۫ ثُمَّ اَحْیَاهُمْ ؕ اِنَّ اللّٰهَ لَذُوْ فَضْلٍ عَلَی النَّاسِ وَ لٰكِنَّ اَكْثَرَ النَّاسِ لَا یَشْكُرُوْنَ۝۲۴۳

Have you not considered those who left their homes in thousands, fearing death? And Allah said to them, "Die." Then He brought them back to life. Indeed, Allah is a possessor of bounty for the people, but most people do not show gratitude.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 243

Footnote :

From this point to verse 260, two topics are discussed. The main objective is to encourage jihad. However, since the hypocrites and cowardly people were very afraid of death, they were hesitant to go to war, which is why the second topic is also discussed. The summary of this topic is that life and death are in the hands of Allah alone. He can cause death even without war and can protect a person's life even in the middle of a fierce battle. Moreover, He has the power to bring a person back to life after death. While this power will be fully manifested in the Hereafter, He has also shown the world some examples where dead people have been brought back to life. One such example is shown in this verse (243).

Furthermore, in verse 253, it is hinted that Allah gave life to several dead people through Prophet Isa (Jesus). Similarly, verse 258 describes the conversation between Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) and Nimrud, showing that the matter of life and death is completely in Allah's hands. The fourth event is described in verse 259, which recounts the story of Prophet Uzair. Then, the fifth event is mentioned in verse 260, where Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) requested Allah to show him how He brings the dead back to life.

The event described in the current verse (No. 243) is not detailed in the Quran. It is only mentioned that at one point in time, a community left their homes in thousands to escape death. But Allah still caused their death. Then, He brought them back to life to show that if a person disobeys Allah's command and uses some trick to escape death, there is no guarantee that they will succeed. No matter what strategy they adopt, Allah can still make them taste death.

Who were these people? What was the time period? What was the reason they were fleeing from death? These details are not mentioned in the Quran. They are not mentioned because the Quran is not a history book. The purpose of the events narrated in it is only to provide a lesson. Therefore, only the parts of the events that provide that lesson are narrated. The part of this event that has been described provides the lesson mentioned above.

However, the manner in which the Quran refers to the event suggests that it was famous and well-known among people at that time. The verse begins with the phrase, "Do you not know their situation?" This indicates that the event was well-known. Therefore, Hafiz Ibn Jarir Tabari (may Allah have mercy on him) has cited several narrations from Abdullah ibn Abbas and some of the Tabi'een, which suggest that this was an event of the Children of Israel. Despite being thousands in number, they did not have the courage to face the enemy. Instead, they fled their homes in fear of death. Alternatively, they fled the area for fear of being afflicted with the plague. As soon as they reached the place they considered safe, they died by the command of Allah. Much later, when their bones had decayed, Prophet Hizqeel (Ezekiel) passed by that place. Allah commanded him to call out to the bones. As soon as he called out, life was breathed into the bones, and they came back to life in complete human form. This event of Prophet Hizqeel is also mentioned in the current Bible (see Ezekiel 37:1-15). Thus, it is not impossible that this event was spread in Medina through the Jews.

Whether the above details of the event are reliable or not, it is clear and straightforward from the Quranic verse that they were truly brought back to life after being dead. Some modern writers, who consider the resurrection of the dead to be illogical, have interpreted this verse to mean that 'death' refers to political and moral death, and 'bringing to life' means political victory. However, this interpretation does not align with the clear wording of the Quran, nor is it consistent with the Arabic literary style and Quranic narrative. The simple fact is that if one has faith in the immense power of Allah, there is nothing to be astonished about in such events. So, why the need for such far-fetched interpretations? Especially in the context of the series of discussions from this verse to verse 260, the summary of which has been given before, the literal meaning of death and life is more logical here.
Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

مَنْ ذَا الَّذِیْ یُقْرِضُ اللّٰهَ قَرْضًا حَسَنًا فَیُضٰعِفَهٗ لَهٗۤ اَضْعَافًا كَثِیْرَةً ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ یَقْبِضُ وَ یَبْصُۜطُ ۪ وَ اِلَیْهِ تُرْجَعُوْنَ۝۲۴۵

Who is it that would loan Allah a goodly loan so He may multiply it for him many times over? And it is Allah who withholds and grants abundance, and to Him you will be returned.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 245

Footnote :

"Lending to Allah" means spending in His way. This includes helping the poor as well as spending on jihad. This is called a "loan" metaphorically, because its repayment will be in the form of divine reward. "In a good manner" means giving with sincerity, with the sole intention of pleasing Allah. It should not be for showing off to people or for gaining worldly returns. If a loan is given for jihad or to help the poor, there should be no demand for interest.

The disbelievers used to take out interest-bearing loans for their military needs. Muslims have been warned that, first, they should give donations rather than loans. If they must give a loan, they should not demand more than the principal amount. Even though they will not receive interest in this world, Allah will give them a reward in the Hereafter that will be many times greater than the principal.

Regarding the fear that such spending might diminish one's wealth, Allah says that both scarcity and abundance are in His hands. A person who spends their wealth for the sake of Allah's religion will not face hardship if they have spent according to His command.
Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ قَالَ لَهُمْ نَبِیُّهُمْ اِنَّ اللّٰهَ قَدْ بَعَثَ لَكُمْ طَالُوْتَ مَلِكًا ؕ قَالُوْۤا اَنّٰی یَكُوْنُ لَهُ الْمُلْكُ عَلَیْنَا وَ نَحْنُ اَحَقُّ بِالْمُلْكِ مِنْهُ وَ لَمْ یُؤْتَ سَعَةً مِّنَ الْمَالِ ؕ قَالَ اِنَّ اللّٰهَ اصْطَفٰىهُ عَلَیْكُمْ وَ زَادَهٗ بَسْطَةً فِی الْعِلْمِ وَ الْجِسْمِ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ یُؤْتِیْ مُلْكَهٗ مَنْ یَّشَآءُ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ وَاسِعٌ عَلِیْمٌ۝۲۴۷

And their prophet said to them, "Indeed, Allah has sent to you Saul (Talut) as a king." They said, "How can he have kingship over us while we are more worthy of kingship than him, and he has not been given an abundance of wealth?" He said, "Indeed, Allah has chosen him over you and has increased him abundantly in knowledge and body. And Allah gives His sovereignty to whom He wills. And Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing."

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 247

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ لَمَّا بَرَزُوْا لِجَالُوْتَ وَ جُنُوْدِهٖ قَالُوْا رَبَّنَاۤ اَفْرِغْ عَلَیْنَا صَبْرًا وَّ ثَبِّتْ اَقْدَامَنَا وَ انْصُرْنَا عَلَی الْقَوْمِ الْكٰفِرِیْنَؕ۝۲۵۰

And when they went forth to [face] Goliath (Jalut) and his soldiers, they said, "Our Lord, pour upon us patience and make our steps firm and grant us victory over the disbelieving people."

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 250

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

فَهَزَمُوْهُمْ بِاِذْنِ اللّٰهِ ۙ۫ وَ قَتَلَ دَاوٗدُ جَالُوْتَ وَ اٰتٰىهُ اللّٰهُ الْمُلْكَ وَ الْحِكْمَةَ وَ عَلَّمَهٗ مِمَّا یَشَآءُ ؕ وَ لَوْ لَا دَفْعُ اللّٰهِ النَّاسَ بَعْضَهُمْ بِبَعْضٍ ۙ لَّفَسَدَتِ الْاَرْضُ وَ لٰكِنَّ اللّٰهَ ذُوْ فَضْلٍ عَلَی الْعٰلَمِیْنَ۝۲۵۱

So they defeated them by permission of Allah, and David killed Goliath. And Allah gave him the kingship and wisdom and taught him from that which He willed. And if it were not for Allah checking [some] people by means of others, the earth would have been corrupted. But Allah is a possessor of bounty for the worlds.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 251

Footnote :

Goliath (Jalut) was a giant champion in the enemy army. The first chapter in the Bible in the name of Prophet Samuel (peace be upon him) states that for several days, he kept challenging the Children of Israel, "Who is there to fight me?" But no one had the courage to face him in combat.

Prophet David (peace be upon him) was a young man at the time. His three brothers were participating in the war. Being the youngest, he stayed behind to serve his elderly father. After a few days of war, his father sent him to the battlefield to check on his brothers. Upon reaching the field, he saw that Goliath was continuously issuing challenges, and no one was stepping forward to fight him. This sight stirred his pride. He asked King Saul (Talut) for permission to go to the battlefield to fight Goliath. At first, Saul and others were hesitant due to his young age. Finally, after his insistence, he was granted permission. He went before Goliath, invoked the name of Allah, and threw a stone that struck him directly on the forehead. The stone went through his head, and he immediately fell to the ground. Then, David (peace be upon him) went to him and decapitated him with his own sword (1 Samuel, Chapter 17).

Up to this point, there is no conflict between the Bible's and the Quran's accounts. However, after this, the Bible says that Saul (or Ma'ul) became envious of Prophet David's popularity. In this context, the Bible narrates various unbelievable stories about him. It is very likely that this was propaganda from the faction of the Children of Israel who were opposed to Saul from the beginning. The way the Quran praises Saul, it is unlikely that he would harbor a disease like jealousy and malice.

In any case, because of his feat of killing Goliath, Prophet David gained such popularity that he later became the king of the Children of Israel. Additionally, Allah also honored him with the rank of prophethood. He was the first person in whom both prophethood and kingship were combined.
Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

تِلْكَ الرُّسُلُ فَضَّلْنَا بَعْضَهُمْ عَلٰی بَعْضٍ ۘ مِنْهُمْ مَّنْ كَلَّمَ اللّٰهُ وَ رَفَعَ بَعْضَهُمْ دَرَجٰتٍ ؕ وَ اٰتَیْنَا عِیْسَی ابْنَ مَرْیَمَ الْبَیِّنٰتِ وَ اَیَّدْنٰهُ بِرُوْحِ الْقُدُسِ ؕ وَ لَوْ شَآءَ اللّٰهُ مَا اقْتَتَلَ الَّذِیْنَ مِنْۢ بَعْدِهِمْ مِّنْۢ بَعْدِ مَا جَآءَتْهُمُ الْبَیِّنٰتُ وَ لٰكِنِ اخْتَلَفُوْا فَمِنْهُمْ مَّنْ اٰمَنَ وَ مِنْهُمْ مَّنْ كَفَرَ ؕ وَ لَوْ شَآءَ اللّٰهُ مَا اقْتَتَلُوْا ۫ وَ لٰكِنَّ اللّٰهَ یَفْعَلُ مَا یُرِیْدُ۠۝۲۵۳

These messengers, some of them We have preferred over others. Among them is one to whom Allah spoke, and He raised some of them in degrees. And We gave Jesus, the son of Mary, clear proofs and supported him with the Holy Spirit. And if Allah had willed, those [generations] succeeding them would not have fought each other after the clear proofs had come to them. But they differed, so some of them believed and some of them disbelieved. And if Allah had willed, they would not have fought each other, but Allah does what He intends.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 253

Footnote :

This means that while many prophets have some level of superiority over others, certain prophets possess much greater virtue over the rest. This is a subtle reference to the Great Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him).
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

ٰۤاَیُّهَا الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوْۤا اَنْفِقُوْا مِمَّا رَزَقْنٰكُمْ مِّنْ قَبْلِ اَنْ یَّاْتِیَ یَوْمٌ لَّا بَیْعٌ فِیْهِ وَ لَا خُلَّةٌ وَّ لَا شَفَاعَةٌ ؕ وَ الْكٰفِرُوْنَ هُمُ الظّٰلِمُوْنَ۝۲۵۴

O you who have believed, spend from that which We have provided for you before there comes a Day in which there will be no exchange, nor companionship, nor intercession. And the disbelievers - they are the wrongdoers.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 254

Footnote :

This refers to the Day of Judgment.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

لَاۤ اِكْرَاهَ فِى الدِّيْنِ ۚ قَدْ تَّبَیَّنَ الرُّشْدُ مِنَ الْغَیِّ ۚ فَمَنْ یَّكْفُرْ بِالطَّاغُوْتِ وَ یُؤْمِنْۢ بِاللّٰهِ فَقَدِ اسْتَمْسَكَ بِالْعُرْوَةِ الْوُثْقٰی ۗ لَا انْفِصَامَ لَهَا ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ سَمِیْعٌ عَلِیْمٌ۝۲۵۶

There shall be no compulsion in [acceptance of] the religion. The right course has become clear from the wrong one. So whoever disbelieves in false deities and believes in Allah has grasped the most trustworthy handhold with no break in it. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 207

Footnote :

The literal meaning of 'taghut' is one who transgresses a limit. It refers to the deities and idols of the polytheists, as well as everything that deviates from the path of Allah and misguides people.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

لَاۤ اِكْرَاهَ فِى الدِّيْنِ ۚ قَدْ تَّبَیَّنَ الرُّشْدُ مِنَ الْغَیِّ ۚ فَمَنْ یَّكْفُرْ بِالطَّاغُوْتِ وَ یُؤْمِنْۢ بِاللّٰهِ فَقَدِ اسْتَمْسَكَ بِالْعُرْوَةِ الْوُثْقٰی ۗ لَا انْفِصَامَ لَهَا ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ سَمِیْعٌ عَلِیْمٌ۝۲۵۶

There shall be no compulsion in [acceptance of] the religion. The right course has become clear from the wrong one. So whoever disbelieves in false deities and believes in Allah has grasped the most trustworthy handhold with no break in it. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 256

Footnote :

The literal meaning of 'taghut' is one who transgresses a limit. It refers to the deities and idols of the polytheists, as well as everything that deviates from the path of Allah and misguides people.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اَلَمْ تَرَ اِلَی الَّذِیْ حَآجَّ اِبْرٰهٖمَ فِیْ رَبِّهٖۤ اَنْ اٰتٰىهُ اللّٰهُ الْمُلْكَ ۘ اِذْ قَالَ اِبْرٰهٖمُ رَبِّیَ الَّذِیْ یُحْیٖ وَ یُمِیْتُ ۙ قَالَ اَنَا اُحْیٖ وَ اُمِیْتُ ؕ قَالَ اِبْرٰهٖمُ فَاِنَّ اللّٰهَ یَاْتِیْ بِالشَّمْسِ مِنَ الْمَشْرِقِ فَاْتِ بِهَا مِنَ الْمَغْرِبِ فَبُهِتَ الَّذِیْ كَفَرَ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ لَا یَهْدِی الْقَوْمَ الظّٰلِمِیْنَۚ۝۲۵۸

Have you not considered the one who argued with Abraham about his Lord because Allah had given him kingship? When Abraham said, "My Lord is the one who gives life and causes death," he said, "I give life and cause death." Abraham said, "Indeed, Allah brings up the sun from the east, so bring it up from the west." So the disbeliever was dumbfounded. And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 258

Footnote :

This refers to the king of Babylon, Nimrod. He claimed to be a god. His claim, "I give life and cause death," meant that because he was king, he could take the life of anyone he wished and could pardon and release those who deserved the death penalty, thus "giving them life."

It's clear that his response was not at all consistent, as the discussion was not about the tools of life and death, but about their creation. However, Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him) saw that Nimrod either didn't understand what the creation of life and death meant, or he was deliberately engaging in a sophistical argument.

Eventually, Prophet Ibrahim said something for which Nimrod had no answer. But instead of accepting the truth when he was silenced, he first had Prophet Ibrahim arrested and then ordered him to be thrown into a fire, as described in Surah Al-Anbiya (21:68-71), Surah Al-Ankabut (29:24), and Surah As-Saffat (37:97).
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

مَثَلُ الَّذِیْنَ یُنْفِقُوْنَ اَمْوَالَهُمْ فِیْ سَبِیْلِ اللّٰهِ كَمَثَلِ حَبَّةٍ اَنْۢبَتَتْ سَبْعَ سَنَابِلَ فِیْ كُلِّ سُنْۢبُلَةٍ مِّائَةُ حَبَّةٍ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ یُضٰعِفُ لِمَنْ یَّشَآءُ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ وَاسِعٌ عَلِیْمٌ۝۲۶۱

The example of those who spend their wealth in the way of Allah is like a seed [of grain] which grows seven ears, in each ear a hundred grains. And Allah multiplies for whom He wills. And Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 261

Footnote :

When one spends in the way of Allah, they receive a reward of seven hundred times. Allah the Almighty grants even more to whomever He wishes. It is clear that the Quran has repeatedly mentioned spending in the way of Allah. This refers to any kind of spending that is done to attain the pleasure of Allah. Zakat, sadaqah, and other forms of charity are all included in this.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اَلَّذِیْنَ یُنْفِقُوْنَ اَمْوَالَهُمْ فِیْ سَبِیْلِ اللّٰهِ ثُمَّ لَا یُتْبِعُوْنَ مَاۤ اَنْفَقُوْا مَنًّا وَّ لَاۤ اَذًی ۙ لَّهُمْ اَجْرُهُمْ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِمْ ۚ وَ لَا خَوْفٌ عَلَیْهِمْ وَ لَا هُمْ یَحْزَنُوْنَ۝۲۶۲

Those who spend their wealth in the way of Allah and then do not follow up what they have spent with reminders of their generosity or with annoyance - for them is their reward with their Lord, and there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 262

Footnote :

They will not have any fear of a reduction in their reward, and upon seeing their boundless reward, they will feel no sorrow for the worldly possessions they left behind.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

قَوْلٌ مَّعْرُوْفٌ وَّ مَغْفِرَةٌ خَیْرٌ مِّنْ صَدَقَةٍ یَّتْبَعُهَاۤ اَذًی ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ غَنِیٌّ حَلِیْمٌ۝۲۶۳

Kind speech and forgiveness are better than charity followed by injury. And Allah is Free of need and Forbearing.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 263

Footnote :

If a person in need asks for help and one is unable to give, it is better to respond with gentle words and seek their forgiveness. And even if that person persists or behaves improperly, it is better to forgive them. This approach is far superior to giving charity that is followed by hurtful reminders or humiliation.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

یٰۤاَیُّهَا الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوْا لَا تُبْطِلُوْا صَدَقٰتِكُمْ بِالْمَنِّ وَ الْاَذٰی ۙ كَالَّذِیْ یُنْفِقُ مَالَهٗ رِئَآءَ النَّاسِ وَ لَا یُؤْمِنُ بِاللّٰهِ وَ الْیَوْمِ الْاٰخِرِ ؕ فَمَثَلُهٗ كَمَثَلِ صَفْوَانٍ عَلَیْهِ تُرَابٌ فَاَصَابَهٗ وَابِلٌ فَتَرَكَهٗ صَلْدًا ؕ لَا یَقْدِرُوْنَ عَلٰی شَیْءٍ مِّمَّا كَسَبُوْا ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ لَا یَهْدِی الْقَوْمَ الْكٰفِرِیْنَ۝۲۶۴

O you who have believed, do not invalidate your charities with reminders of your generosity or with injury, like one who spends his wealth [only] to be seen by the people and does not believe in Allah and the Last Day. His example is like that of a [smooth] stone upon which is dust; then a rainstorm strikes it, leaving it bare. They are unable to acquire anything of what they have earned. And Allah does not guide the disbelieving people.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 264

Footnote :

One might hope to sow a seed on a large stone if soil has gathered on it. However, if rain washes the soil away, the smooth stone becomes unfit for any cultivation. Similarly, there is hope of receiving a reward in the afterlife from giving charity. But if that charity is given to show off to people, and then the giver reminds the recipient of the favor, it washes away the charity. As a result, there is no hope of a reward.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran
