In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ مَثَلُ الَّذِیْنَ یُنْفِقُوْنَ اَمْوَالَهُمُ ابْتِغَآءَ مَرْضَاتِ اللّٰهِ وَ تَثْبِیْتًا مِّنْ اَنْفُسِهِمْ كَمَثَلِ جَنَّةٍۭ بِرَبْوَةٍ اَصَابَهَا وَابِلٌ فَاٰتَتْ اُكُلَهَا ضِعْفَیْنِ ۚ فَاِنْ لَّمْ یُصِبْهَا وَابِلٌ فَطَلٌّ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُوْنَ بَصِیْرٌ۝۲۶۵

And the example of those who spend their wealth seeking the approval of Allah and to make sure of their souls is like a garden on a hill. A downpour falls on it, and it yields its fruits twofold. And if it is not hit by a downpour, then a light rain is sufficient. And Allah is all-seeing of what you do.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 265

Footnote :

The love for wealth is an innate human trait. Therefore, spending it is more difficult than other forms of worship. It puts great pressure on the mind. By ignoring this pressure and continuing to spend in the way of Allah, the mind eventually submits to the consciousness of faith. This makes it easier to achieve firmness and maturity in faith and righteous deeds.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

یٰۤاَیُّهَا الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوْۤا اَنْفِقُوْا مِنْ طَیِّبٰتِ مَا كَسَبْتُمْ وَ مِمَّاۤ اَخْرَجْنَا لَكُمْ مِّنَ الْاَرْضِ ۪ وَ لَا تَیَمَّمُوا الْخَبِیْثَ مِنْهُ تُنْفِقُوْنَ وَ لَسْتُمْ بِاٰخِذِیْهِ اِلَّاۤ اَنْ تُغْمِضُوْا فِیْهِ ؕ وَ اعْلَمُوْۤا اَنَّ اللّٰهَ غَنِیٌّ حَمِیْدٌ۝۲۶۷

O you who have believed, spend from the good things which you have earned and from that which We have produced for you from the earth. And do not aim for the bad [of it] to spend therefrom, while you would not take it yourselves except with closed eyes. And know that Allah is Free of need and Praiseworthy.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 267

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اَلشَّیْطٰنُ یَعِدُكُمُ الْفَقْرَ وَ یَاْمُرُكُمْ بِالْفَحْشَآءِ ۚ وَ اللّٰهُ یَعِدُكُمْ مَّغْفِرَةً مِّنْهُ وَ فَضْلًا ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ وَاسِعٌ عَلِیْمٌۖۙ۝۲۶۸

Satan threatens you with poverty and orders you to immorality, while Allah promises you forgiveness from Him and bounty. And Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 268

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

یُّؤْتِی الْحِكْمَةَ مَنْ یَّشَآءُ ۚ وَ مَنْ یُّؤْتَ الْحِكْمَةَ فَقَدْ اُوْتِیَ خَیْرًا كَثِیْرًا ؕ وَ مَا یَذَّكَّرُ اِلَّاۤ اُولُوا الْاَلْبَابِ۝۲۶۹

He gives wisdom to whom He wills, and whoever has been given wisdom has certainly been given much good. And none will remember except those of understanding.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 269

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ مَاۤ اَنْفَقْتُمْ مِّنْ نَّفَقَةٍ اَوْ نَذَرْتُمْ مِّنْ نَّذْرٍ فَاِنَّ اللّٰهَ یَعْلَمُهٗ ؕ وَ مَا لِلظّٰلِمِیْنَ مِنْ اَنْصَارٍ۝۲۷۰

And whatever you spend of expenditures or make of vows - indeed, Allah knows of it. And for the wrongdoers there are no helpers.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 270

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اِنْ تُبْدُوا الصَّدَقٰتِ فَنِعِمَّا هِیَ ۚ وَ اِنْ تُخْفُوْهَا وَ تُؤْتُوْهَا الْفُقَرَآءَ فَهُوَ خَیْرٌ لَّكُمْ ؕ وَ یُكَفِّرُ عَنْكُمْ مِّنْ سَیِّاٰتِكُمْ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُوْنَ خَبِیْرٌ۝۲۷۱

If you disclose your charities, it is well; but if you conceal them and give them to the poor, it is better for you. And He will remove from you [some of] your misdeeds. And Allah is fully acquainted with what you do.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 271

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

لَیْسَ عَلَیْكَ هُدٰىهُمْ وَ لٰكِنَّ اللّٰهَ یَهْدِیْ مَنْ یَّشَآءُ ؕ وَ مَا تُنْفِقُوْا مِنْ خَیْرٍ فَلِاَنْفُسِكُمْ ؕ وَ مَا تُنْفِقُوْنَ اِلَّا ابْتِغَآءَ وَجْهِ اللّٰهِ ؕ وَ مَا تُنْفِقُوْا مِنْ خَیْرٍ یُّوَفَّ اِلَیْكُمْ وَ اَنْتُمْ لَا تُظْلَمُوْنَ۝۲۷۲

(O Prophet!) It is not your responsibility to guide them, but Allah guides whom He wills. And whatever you spend of good is for yourselves, and you do not spend except seeking the countenance of Allah. And whatever you spend of good will be fully repaid to you, and you will not be wronged.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 272

Footnote :

Some of the Ansar companions had some poor relatives, but because they were disbelievers, the companions did not help them. They were waiting for them to accept Islam, at which point they would provide help and support. Some narrations suggest that the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) himself advised them to do this. In response to this, the verse in question was revealed (Ruhul Ma'ani).

In this way, the Muslims were informed that the responsibility for their conversion to Islam does not fall on them. Even if you spend money on those poor disbelievers with the intention of gaining Allah’s pleasure, you will still receive the full reward for it.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

لَیْسَ عَلَیْكَ هُدٰىهُمْ وَ لٰكِنَّ اللّٰهَ یَهْدِیْ مَنْ یَّشَآءُ ؕ وَ مَا تُنْفِقُوْا مِنْ خَیْرٍ فَلِاَنْفُسِكُمْ ؕ وَ مَا تُنْفِقُوْنَ اِلَّا ابْتِغَآءَ وَجْهِ اللّٰهِ ؕ وَ مَا تُنْفِقُوْا مِنْ خَیْرٍ یُّوَفَّ اِلَیْكُمْ وَ اَنْتُمْ لَا تُظْلَمُوْنَ۝۲۷۲

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اَلَّذِیْنَ یُنْفِقُوْنَ اَمْوَالَهُمْ بِالَّیْلِ وَ النَّهَارِ سِرًّا وَّ عَلَانِیَةً فَلَهُمْ اَجْرُهُمْ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِمْ ۚ وَ لَا خَوْفٌ عَلَیْهِمْ وَ لَا هُمْ یَحْزَنُوْنَؔ۝۲۷۴

Those who spend their wealth [in the way of Allah] by night and by day, secretly and publicly - they will have their reward with their Lord. And there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 274

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اَلَّذِیْنَ یَاْكُلُوْنَ الرِّبٰوا لَا یَقُوْمُوْنَ اِلَّا كَمَا یَقُوْمُ الَّذِیْ یَتَخَبَّطُهُ الشَّیْطٰنُ مِنَ الْمَسِّ ؕ ذٰلِكَ بِاَنَّهُمْ قَالُوْۤا اِنَّمَا الْبَیْعُ مِثْلُ الرِّبٰوا ۘ وَ اَحَلَّ اللّٰهُ الْبَیْعَ وَ حَرَّمَ الرِّبٰوا ؕ فَمَنْ جَآءَهٗ مَوْعِظَةٌ مِّنْ رَّبِّهٖ فَانْتَهٰی فَلَهٗ مَا سَلَفَ ؕ وَ اَمْرُهٗۤ اِلَی اللّٰهِ ؕ وَ مَنْ عَادَ فَاُولٰٓىِٕكَ اَصْحٰبُ النَّارِ ۚ هُمْ فِیْهَا خٰلِدُوْنَ۝۲۷۵

Those who consume interest will not stand [on the Day of Judgment] except like one whom Satan has a demoniac hold over. That is because they said, "Trade is only like interest." But Allah has permitted trade and forbidden interest. So whoever receives an admonition from his Lord and desists - for him is what was in the past, and his affair is left to Allah. But whoever returns [to dealing in interest] - those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide eternally therein.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 275

Footnote :

An extra amount of money charged on any loan is called 'riba' or interest. The polytheists used to say, "Just as we earn a profit from selling a product and the Sharia has made that lawful, what is the problem with earning a profit from giving a loan?"

The answer to their question was this: The purpose of a product is to earn a profit by selling it. On the other hand, money was not created to be a commodity for earning a profit. Money is a medium of exchange. It was created with the purpose of facilitating the buying and selling of necessary goods. If currency is exchanged for currency and made a means of earning profit, various harms and evils arise from it. (For more details on this, one can refer to the judgment I wrote on 'riba' in the Pakistan Supreme Court. Its Urdu translation has also been published under the title 'Sud Par Tarikhi Faisla' - 'A Historic Verdict on Interest').

However, in this instance, instead of explaining the difference between trade and interest, Allah the Almighty gave a sovereign-like response. It was stated that when Allah has made trade lawful and interest unlawful, it is not the job of a servant to question its meaning and philosophy, or to show an attitude of not obeying the command until they understand it.

The reality is that every command of Allah undoubtedly contains some wisdom, but it is not necessary that this wisdom will be understood by everyone. Therefore, if one has faith in Allah, they should first accept His command. After that, if someone tries to understand the wisdom and mystery for additional peace of mind, there is no harm in it. The fault lies in postponing the implementation of the command until the wisdom is understood, which cannot be the approach of a believer.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

یَمْحَقُ اللّٰهُ الرِّبٰوا وَ یُرْبِی الصَّدَقٰتِ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ لَا یُحِبُّ كُلَّ كَفَّارٍ اَثِیْمٍ۝۲۷۶

Allah destroys interest and gives increase for charities. And Allah does not like every ungrateful, sinner.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 276

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اِنَّ الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوْا وَ عَمِلُوا الصّٰلِحٰتِ وَ اَقَامُوا الصَّلٰوةَ وَ اٰتَوُا الزَّكٰوةَ لَهُمْ اَجْرُهُمْ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِمْ ۚ وَ لَا خَوْفٌ عَلَیْهِمْ وَ لَا هُمْ یَحْزَنُوْنَ۝۲۷۷

Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds and established prayer and given zakah will have their reward with their Lord, and there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 277

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

یٰۤاَیُّهَا الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوا اتَّقُوا اللّٰهَ وَ ذَرُوْا مَا بَقِیَ مِنَ الرِّبٰۤوا اِنْ كُنْتُمْ مُّؤْمِنِیْنَ۝۲۷۸

O you who have believed, fear Allah and give up what remains of interest, if you should be believers.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 278

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

فَاِنْ لَّمْ تَفْعَلُوْا فَاْذَنُوْا بِحَرْبٍ مِّنَ اللّٰهِ وَ رَسُوْلِهٖ ۚ وَ اِنْ تُبْتُمْ فَلَكُمْ رُءُوْسُ اَمْوَالِكُمْ ۚ لَا تَظْلِمُوْنَ وَ لَا تُظْلَمُوْنَ۝۲۷۹

And if you do not [comply], then be informed of a war [against you] from Allah and His Messenger. But if you repent, you may have your principal - [thus] you do no wrong, nor are you wronged.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 279

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ اِنْ كَانَ ذُوْ عُسْرَةٍ فَنَظِرَةٌ اِلٰی مَیْسَرَةٍ ؕ وَ اَنْ تَصَدَّقُوْا خَیْرٌ لَّكُمْ اِنْ كُنْتُمْ تَعْلَمُوْنَ۝۲۸۰

And if there is a person in hardship, then [give] a postponement until a time of ease. But if you give [the debt] as charity, it is better for you, if you only knew.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 280

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ اتَّقُوْا یَوْمًا تُرْجَعُوْنَ فِیْهِ اِلَی اللّٰهِ ۫ۗ ثُمَّ تُوَفّٰی كُلُّ نَفْسٍ مَّا كَسَبَتْ وَ هُمْ لَا یُظْلَمُوْنَ۠۝۲۸۱

And fear a Day when you will be returned to Allah. Then every soul will be compensated for what it earned, and they will not be wronged.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 281

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

یٰۤاَیُّهَا الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوْۤا اِذَا تَدَایَنْتُمْ بِدَیْنٍ اِلٰۤی اَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّی فَاكْتُبُوْهُ ؕ وَ لْیَكْتُبْ بَّیْنَكُمْ كَاتِبٌۢ بِالْعَدْلِ ۪ وَ لَا یَاْبَ كَاتِبٌ اَنْ یَّكْتُبَ كَمَا عَلَّمَهُ اللّٰهُ فَلْیَكْتُبْ ۚ وَ لْیُمْلِلِ الَّذِیْ عَلَیْهِ الْحَقُّ وَ لْیَتَّقِ اللّٰهَ رَبَّهٗ وَ لَا یَبْخَسْ مِنْهُ شَیْـًٔا ؕ فَاِنْ كَانَ الَّذِیْ عَلَیْهِ الْحَقُّ سَفِیْهًا اَوْ ضَعِیْفًا اَوْ لَا یَسْتَطِیْعُ اَنْ یُّمِلَّ هُوَ فَلْیُمْلِلْ وَلِیُّهٗ بِالْعَدْلِ ؕ وَ اسْتَشْهِدُوْا شَهِیْدَیْنِ مِنْ رِّجَالِكُمْ ۚ فَاِنْ لَّمْ یَكُوْنَا رَجُلَیْنِ فَرَجُلٌ وَّ امْرَاَتٰنِ مِمَّنْ تَرْضَوْنَ مِنَ الشُّهَدَآءِ اَنْ تَضِلَّ اِحْدٰىهُمَا فَتُذَكِّرَ اِحْدٰىهُمَا الْاُخْرٰی ؕ وَ لَا یَاْبَ الشُّهَدَآءُ اِذَا مَا دُعُوْا ؕ وَ لَا تَسْـَٔمُوْۤا اَنْ تَكْتُبُوْهُ صَغِیْرًا اَوْ كَبِیْرًا اِلٰۤی اَجَلِهٖ ؕ ذٰلِكُمْ اَقْسَطُ عِنْدَ اللّٰهِ وَ اَقْوَمُ لِلشَّهَادَةِ وَ اَدْنٰۤی اَلَّا تَرْتَابُوْۤا اِلَّاۤ اَنْ تَكُوْنَ تِجَارَةً حَاضِرَةً تُدِیْرُوْنَهَا بَیْنَكُمْ فَلَیْسَ عَلَیْكُمْ جُنَاحٌ اَلَّا تَكْتُبُوْهَا ؕ وَ اَشْهِدُوْۤا اِذَا تَبَایَعْتُمْ ۪ وَ لَا یُضَآرَّ كَاتِبٌ وَّ لَا شَهِیْدٌ ؕ۬ وَ اِنْ تَفْعَلُوْا فَاِنَّهٗ فُسُوْقٌۢ بِكُمْ ؕ وَ اتَّقُوا اللّٰهَ ؕ وَ یُعَلِّمُكُمُ اللّٰهُ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ بِكُلِّ شَیْءٍ عَلِیْمٌ۝۲۸۲

O you who have believed, when you contract a debt for a specified term, write it down. And let a scribe write [it] between you in justice. Let no scribe refuse to write as Allah has taught him. So let him write. And let the one who has the obligation dictate. And let him fear Allah, his Lord, and not decrease anything from it. But if the one who has the obligation is foolish or weak or unable to dictate himself, then let his guardian dictate in justice. And bring to witness two witnesses from among your men. And if there are not two men, then [take] a man and two women from those you approve of as witnesses, so that if one of them forgets, the other can remind her. And let not the witnesses refuse when they are called upon. And do not be weary of writing it, whether it is small or large, for its specified term. That is more just in the sight of Allah and more supportive of testimony and more likely to prevent doubt between you, except when it is present-day trade among you, which you manage yourselves. Then there is no blame upon you if you do not write it. But take witnesses when you conclude a contract. And let no scribe be harmed or witness be harmed. And if you do so, it is [a state of] disobedience in you. And fear Allah. And Allah teaches you. And Allah is Knowing of all things.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 282

Footnote :

This is the longest verse in the Quran. After prohibiting interest, this verse provides important guidance regarding other financial transactions. The objective is to ensure that all transactions are conducted transparently and properly. If one person owes another a debt, they should write it down or have it written in a way that the nature of the transaction becomes clear. All details should be explicit, and no form of editing or shortening should be used to usurp someone else's rights.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ اِنْ كُنْتُمْ عَلٰی سَفَرٍ وَّ لَمْ تَجِدُوْا كَاتِبًا فَرِهٰنٌ مَّقْبُوْضَةٌ ؕ فَاِنْ اَمِنَ بَعْضُكُمْ بَعْضًا فَلْیُؤَدِّ الَّذِی اؤْتُمِنَ اَمَانَتَهٗ وَ لْیَتَّقِ اللّٰهَ رَبَّهٗ ؕ وَ لَا تَكْتُمُوا الشَّهَادَةَ ؕ وَ مَنْ یَّكْتُمْهَا فَاِنَّهٗۤ اٰثِمٌ قَلْبُهٗ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُوْنَ عَلِیْمٌ۠۝۲۸۳

And if you are on a journey and do not find a scribe, then a pledge [can be] taken. But if one of you trusts another, then let the one who is trusted discharge his trust and let him fear Allah, his Lord. And do not conceal testimony. And whoever conceals it - his heart is sinful. And Allah is Knowing of what you do.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 283

Footnote :

The reason for specifically mentioning the heart as sinful is that the act of concealing a testimony primarily happens within the heart. The external limbs are not directly involved. This also indicates that concealing testimony is a serious sin. This grave sin can only be committed by a person whose heart has become afflicted with sin. Therefore, along with avoiding this sin, one should also pay special attention to purifying the soul.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

لَا یُكَلِّفُ اللّٰهُ نَفْسًا اِلَّا وُسْعَهَا ؕ لَهَا مَا كَسَبَتْ وَ عَلَیْهَا مَا اكْتَسَبَتْ ؕ رَبَّنَا لَا تُؤَاخِذْنَاۤ اِنْ نَّسِیْنَاۤ اَوْ اَخْطَاْنَا ۚ رَبَّنَا وَ لَا تَحْمِلْ عَلَیْنَاۤ اِصْرًا كَمَا حَمَلْتَهٗ عَلَی الَّذِیْنَ مِنْ قَبْلِنَا ۚ رَبَّنَا وَ لَا تُحَمِّلْنَا مَا لَا طَاقَةَ لَنَا بِهٖ ۚ وَ اعْفُ عَنَّا ۥ وَ اغْفِرْ لَنَا ۥ وَ ارْحَمْنَا ۥ اَنْتَ مَوْلٰىنَا فَانْصُرْنَا عَلَی الْقَوْمِ الْكٰفِرِیْنَ۠۝۲۸۶

(O Muslims! You should pray to Allah saying) Our Lord, do not impose blame upon us if we have forgotten or erred. Our Lord, and lay not upon us a burden like that which You laid upon those before us. Our Lord, and burden us not with that which we have no ability to bear. And pardon us; and forgive us; and have mercy upon us. You are our protector, so give us victory over the disbelieving people.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 286

Footnote :

The last two verses of Surah Al-Baqarah are extremely significant. In one Hadith, it is mentioned that these two verses were given from a hidden treasure beneath the Throne, which was not given to any other prophet (Bukhari, Muslim). In another Hadith, it is stated that whoever recites these two verses at night, they are sufficient for him (Bukhari, Muslim).
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ لَنْ تَرْضٰی عَنْكَ الْیَهُوْدُ وَ لَا النَّصٰرٰی حَتّٰی تَتَّبِعَ مِلَّتَهُمْ ؕ قُلْ اِنَّ هُدَی اللّٰهِ هُوَ الْهُدٰی ؕ وَ لَىِٕنِ اتَّبَعْتَ اَهْوَآءَهُمْ بَعْدَ الَّذِیْ جَآءَكَ مِنَ الْعِلْمِ ۙ مَا لَكَ مِنَ اللّٰهِ مِنْ وَّلِیٍّ وَّ لَا نَصِیْرٍؔ۝۱۲۰

And never will the Jews or the Christians approve of you until you follow their religion. Say, "Indeed, the guidance of Allah is the [only] guidance." If you were to follow their desires after what has come to you of knowledge, you would have against Allah no protector or helper.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 120

Footnote :

Although it was completely inconceivable that the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, would ever follow the whims of the disbelievers, the verse addresses this impossible scenario as if it were a possibility. The purpose is to teach the fundamental principle that a person's importance and status in the sight of Allah are not based on their individual self, but rather on their obedience to Allah. The Great Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, is the best of creation in Allah's sight precisely because he was the most obedient servant of Allah.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ اِذْ جَعَلْنَا الْبَیْتَ مَثَابَةً لِّلنَّاسِ وَ اَمْنًا ؕ وَ اتَّخِذُوْا مِنْ مَّقَامِ اِبْرٰهٖمَ مُصَلًّی ؕ وَ عَهِدْنَاۤ اِلٰۤی اِبْرٰهٖمَ وَ اِسْمٰعِیْلَ اَنْ طَهِّرَا بَیْتِیَ لِلطَّآىِٕفِیْنَ وَ الْعٰكِفِیْنَ وَ الرُّكَّعِ السُّجُوْدِ۝۱۲۵

And [remember] when We made the House a place of return for the people and a [place of] security. And take, [O believers], from the standing place of Abraham a place of prayer. And We charged Abraham and Ishmael, [saying], "Purify My House for those who perform Tawaf and those who are staying there for worship and those who bow and prostrate."

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 125

Footnote :

Maqam Ibrahim is the name of the stone upon which Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham), peace be upon him, stood while he was building the Kaaba. That stone is still preserved today. Anyone who performs the Tawaf of the Kaaba is commanded that after completing the seven circuits, he should stand in front of the Maqam Ibrahim, face the Kaaba, and perform two rakats of prayer. It is best to perform these two rakats of the Tawaf at this spot.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ اِذْ یَرْفَعُ اِبْرٰهٖمُ الْقَوَاعِدَ مِنَ الْبَیْتِ وَ اِسْمٰعِیْلُ ؕ رَبَّنَا تَقَبَّلْ مِنَّا ؕ اِنَّكَ اَنْتَ السَّمِیْعُ الْعَلِیْمُ۝۱۲۷

And [remember] when Abraham was raising the foundations of the House and [with him] Ishmael, [saying], "Our Lord, accept [this] from us. Indeed, You are the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing."

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 127

Footnote :

The Kaaba is also called the Baitullah. This House was built during the time of Prophet Adam (peace be upon him), and ever since then, people have revered it as the House of Allah. At one point, the House was lost to the passage of time. During the time of Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him), not a trace of it remained. Therefore, he was instructed to rebuild it upon its ancient foundations. Allah the Almighty informed him of these foundations through revelation. This is why the Quran states, "He was raising the foundations of the Baitullah," and not that "he was building the Baitullah."
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

رَبَّنَا وَ اجْعَلْنَا مُسْلِمَیْنِ لَكَ وَ مِنْ ذُرِّیَّتِنَاۤ اُمَّةً مُّسْلِمَةً لَّكَ ۪ وَ اَرِنَا مَنَاسِكَنَا وَ تُبْ عَلَیْنَا ۚ اِنَّكَ اَنْتَ التَّوَّابُ الرَّحِیْمُ۝۱۲۸

Our Lord, and make us Muslims [in submission] to You and from our offspring a Muslim community [in submission] to You. And show us our rites and accept our repentance. Indeed, You are the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 128

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

رَبَّنَا وَ ابْعَثْ فِیْهِمْ رَسُوْلًا مِّنْهُمْ یَتْلُوْا عَلَیْهِمْ اٰیٰتِكَ وَ یُعَلِّمُهُمُ الْكِتٰبَ وَ الْحِكْمَةَ وَ یُزَكِّیْهِمْ ؕ اِنَّكَ اَنْتَ الْعَزِیْزُ الْحَكِیْمُ۠۝۱۲۹

Our Lord, and send among them a messenger from themselves who will recite to them Your verses and teach them the Book and wisdom and purify them. Indeed, You are the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 129

Footnote :

It is impossible to express in any other language the impact that this heartfelt prayer can have. A translation can only convey its essence. The narration of this prayer here serves several purposes.

One purpose is to show that even when prophets (peace be upon them) perform great deeds, they do not show arrogance. Instead, they demonstrate even greater humility and meekness before Allah the Almighty. They do not get busy publicizing their achievements but instead engage in repentance and seeking forgiveness for any potential errors in their work.

Second, all their actions are for the purpose of gaining Allah's pleasure. Therefore, instead of seeking people's praise for their work, they pray to Allah for its acceptance.

Third, it is also intended to show that the advent of the Prophet (peace be upon him) was included in the prayer of Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him). In this way, Prophet Ibrahim himself proposed that the Prophet (peace be upon him) be sent from the lineage of Prophet Ismail (peace be upon him), not from the lineage of Prophet Israel (peace be upon him), i.e., the Children of Israel.

This prayer, spoken through the tongue of Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him), also expresses the fundamental objectives of the Prophet Muhammad’s (peace be upon him) arrival. These objectives have been highlighted in several places in the Quran. Their explanation will, by the will of Allah, come in verse 151 of this very surah.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ مَنْ یَّرْغَبُ عَنْ مِّلَّةِ اِبْرٰهٖمَ اِلَّا مَنْ سَفِهَ نَفْسَهٗ ؕ وَ لَقَدِ اصْطَفَیْنٰهُ فِی الدُّنْیَا ۚ وَ اِنَّهٗ فِی الْاٰخِرَةِ لَمِنَ الصّٰلِحِیْنَ۝۱۳۰

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 130

وَ قَالُوْا كُوْنُوْا هُوْدًا اَوْ نَصٰرٰی تَهْتَدُوْا ؕ قُلْ بَلْ مِلَّةَ اِبْرٰهٖمَ حَنِیْفًا ؕ وَ مَا كَانَ مِنَ الْمُشْرِكِیْنَ۝۱۳۵

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

۝۱۳۵ قُوْلُوْۤا اٰمَنَّا بِاللّٰهِ وَ مَاۤ اُنْزِلَ اِلَیْنَا وَ مَاۤ اُنْزِلَ اِلٰۤی اِبْرٰهٖمَ وَ اِسْمٰعِیْلَ وَ اِسْحٰقَ وَ یَعْقُوْبَ وَ الْاَسْبَاطِ وَ مَاۤ اُوْتِیَ مُوْسٰی وَ عِیْسٰی وَ مَاۤ اُوْتِیَ النَّبِیُّوْنَ مِنْ رَّبِّهِمْ ۚ لَا نُفَرِّقُ بَیْنَ اَحَدٍ مِّنْهُمْ ۖؗ وَ نَحْنُ لَهٗ مُسْلِمُوْنَ۝۱۳۶

(O Muslims!) Say, "We have believed in Allah and in what was revealed to us and what was revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and the Descendants, and in what was given to Moses and Jesus and what was given to the prophets from their Lord. We make no distinction between any of them, and we are Muslims [in submission] to Him."

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 136

Footnote :

We believe in all messengers and all scriptures, and we consider them truthful and worthy of being followed in their respective times. We are obedient to Allah; whenever He sent a prophet and a law through him, we accepted it. However, the People of the Book (Jews and Christians) reject all other religions and prophets except their own and hold on to their own religions, even though they have been abrogated.

According to the teachings of their own prophets and scriptures, it was their duty to believe in the Last Prophet, Muhammad (peace be upon him), after his arrival and to follow the law he brought. This is because he is the last and universal prophet; the chain of prophethood has ended with him, and there is no possibility of a new prophet, book, or law coming after him. Therefore, it is now obligatory for all people of the world, whether Jews, Christians, Arabs, or non-Arabs, to believe in him and follow his law.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

صِبْغَةَ اللّٰهِ ۚ وَ مَنْ اَحْسَنُ مِنَ اللّٰهِ صِبْغَةً ؗ وَّ نَحْنُ لَهٗ عٰبِدُوْنَ۝۱۳۸

(O Muslims! Say, we have adopted) the hue of Allah, and who is better than Allah in hue? And we are His worshipers.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 138

Footnote :

This refers to the Christian practice of "baptism." The act of baptizing is also called istibagh (dyeing or coloring). When a person is initiated into Christianity, they are bathed in colored water. They believe that this act imbues their being with the color of the Christian faith. Newborn babies are also baptized in this manner because they believe that every child is born a sinner from their mother's womb. Until they are baptized, they remain sinful and are not entitled to the atonement of Jesus Christ.

The Quran states that this baseless idea has no foundation. If one must be colored by a "dye," then adopt the color of Allah, which is pure monotheism. There is no better color than this.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

قَدْ نَرٰی تَقَلُّبَ وَجْهِكَ فِی السَّمَآءِ ۚ فَلَنُوَلِّیَنَّكَ قِبْلَةً تَرْضٰىهَا ۪ فَوَلِّ وَجْهَكَ شَطْرَ الْمَسْجِدِ الْحَرَامِ ؕ وَ حَیْثُ مَا كُنْتُمْ فَوَلُّوْا وُجُوْهَكُمْ شَطْرَهٗ ؕ وَ اِنَّ الَّذِیْنَ اُوْتُوا الْكِتٰبَ لَیَعْلَمُوْنَ اَنَّهُ الْحَقُّ مِنْ رَّبِّهِمْ ؕ وَ مَا اللّٰهُ بِغَافِلٍ عَمَّا یَعْمَلُوْنَ۝۱۴۴

(O Prophet!) We have certainly seen the turning of your face toward the heaven. So We will surely turn you to a qiblah with which you will be pleased. So turn your face toward the Masjid al-Haram. And wherever you [believers] are, turn your faces toward it [in prayer]. Indeed, those who were given the Scripture surely know that it is the truth from their Lord. And Allah is not unaware of what they do.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 144

Footnote :

The People of the Book (Jews and Christians) know very well that the command to change the Qibla is completely true. One reason for this is that they believed in Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him) and it was historically proven that he built the Holy Kaaba in Makkah at the command of Allah. In fact, some historians have written that the Qibla of all of Prophet Ibrahim's children (including Prophet Isaac, peace be upon him) was the Holy Kaaba. (For more on this topic, see 'Zabih Kaun Hai?' by Maulana Hamiduddin Farahi, pages 35-38).
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اَلَّذِیْنَ اٰتَیْنٰهُمُ الْكِتٰبَ یَعْرِفُوْنَهٗ كَمَا یَعْرِفُوْنَ اَبْنَآءَهُمْ ؕ وَ اِنَّ فَرِیْقًا مِّنْهُمْ لَیَكْتُمُوْنَ الْحَقَّ وَ هُمْ یَعْلَمُوْنَؔ۝۱۴۶

Those to whom We gave the Scripture know him as they know their own sons. And indeed, a party of them conceal the truth while they know [it].

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 146

Footnote :

This can have two meanings:

They knew well that the Kaaba was the Qibla, as was mentioned earlier.

It can also mean that the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) was the same Messenger whose coming was foretold in the scriptures of the earlier prophets. They knew this very well, but out of stubbornness and obstinacy, they refused to acknowledge it.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ مِنْ حَیْثُ خَرَجْتَ فَوَلِّ وَجْهَكَ شَطْرَ الْمَسْجِدِ الْحَرَامِ ؕ وَ اِنَّهٗ لَلْحَقُّ مِنْ رَّبِّكَ ؕ وَ مَا اللّٰهُ بِغَافِلٍ عَمَّا تَعْمَلُوْنَ۝۱۴۹

And from wherever you go out [for a journey], turn your face toward al-Masjid al-Haram. And indeed, it is the truth from your Lord. And Allah is not unaware of what you do.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 149

Footnote :

In the verses in question, Allah the Almighty has repeated the command to face the Masjid al-Haram three times. One purpose of this is to emphasize the importance and urgency of the command. The second is to make it clear that the command to face the Qibla does not apply only when one is in front of the Kaaba. The same rule applies when one is outside Makkah, and it remains equally binding no matter how far away one is.

In this context, Allah the Almighty used the word "shatr" (direction) to indicate that it is not necessary to be in a perfectly straight line with the Kaaba to face it. It is sufficient if the direction is towards the Kaaba; the command will be fulfilled. A person's duty in this regard is to use the best means available to determine the direction. Doing so will make their prayer valid.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ مِنْ حَیْثُ خَرَجْتَ فَوَلِّ وَجْهَكَ شَطْرَ الْمَسْجِدِ الْحَرَامِ ؕ وَ حَیْثُ مَا كُنْتُمْ فَوَلُّوْا وُجُوْهَكُمْ شَطْرَهٗ ۙ لِئَلَّا یَكُوْنَ لِلنَّاسِ عَلَیْكُمْ حُجَّةٌ ۙۗ اِلَّا الَّذِیْنَ ظَلَمُوْا مِنْهُمْ ۗ فَلَا تَخْشَوْهُمْ وَ اخْشَوْنِیْ ۗ وَ لِاُتِمَّ نِعْمَتِیْ عَلَیْكُمْ وَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَهْتَدُوْنَۙۛ۝۱۵۰

And from wherever you go out [for a journey or otherwise], turn your face toward al-Masjid al-Haram. And wherever you [believers] are, turn your faces toward it, so that people will not have a proof against you, except for those who are wrongdoers among them; so fear them not, but fear Me. And [this is] so I may complete My favor upon you and that you may be guided.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 150

Footnote :

The meaning of this is that as long as the Qibla was the Bayt al-Maqdis, the Jews would use it as an argument, saying that their religion must be true since the Muslims were compelled to follow their Qibla. On the other hand, the polytheists of Makkah would say that the Muslims claimed to be followers of Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him), yet they had abandoned the Qibla of Ibrahim and turned away from him in a major way.

Now that the purpose of the change of Qibla has been achieved and the Muslims will permanently consider the Kaaba as their Qibla and follow it, the opponents no longer have any opportunity for a logical argument. However, the mouths of those argumentative people who have vowed to object to everything cannot be shut. Let them object. The Muslims do not need to fear them. Muslims should only fear Allah the Almighty and no one else.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

فَاذْكُرُوْنِیْۤ اَذْكُرْكُمْ وَ اشْكُرُوْا لِیْ وَ لَا تَكْفُرُوْنِ۠۝۱۵۲

So remember Me; I will remember you. And be grateful to Me and do not deny Me.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 152

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

یٰۤاَیُّهَا الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوا اسْتَعِیْنُوْا بِالصَّبْرِ وَ الصَّلٰوةِ ؕ اِنَّ اللّٰهَ مَعَ الصّٰبِرِیْنَ۝۱۵۳

O you who have believed, seek help through patience and prayer. Indeed, Allah is with the patient.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 153

Footnote :

The discussion about the Children of Israel, which began in verse 40 of this surah, has now concluded. The Muslims have been advised at the end not to engage in futile arguments, but rather to strive to practice their religion as much as possible. As such, a discussion about various Islamic beliefs and regulations is now beginning.

The discussion starts by emphasizing patience, as this was a time when the Muslims were facing various obstacles from their enemies in following and spreading their religion. They were engaged in wars against their enemies, which caused them numerous hardships. Many times, relatives and friends had to embrace martyrdom, or there was a possibility of it happening in the future.

Therefore, the Muslims are advised that such trials are inevitable on the path of truth. The duty of a believer is to be content with the will of Allah the Almighty and to show patience and steadfastness. It should be noted that crying in times of distress is not against patience, as shedding tears from pain is a part of human nature. Therefore, the Sharia has not forbidden it. Unintentional crying is also not a lack of patience.

Patience means that despite the pain and sorrow, one does not complain to Allah; instead, one remains intellectually content with Allah's decree. An example can be given with an operation. When a doctor performs an operation, the person feels pain. Many times, they may even scream unintentionally, but they have no complaint against the doctor for performing the operation. This is because they believe that whatever the doctor is doing is out of sympathy and for their benefit.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ لَا تَقُوْلُوْا لِمَنْ یُّقْتَلُ فِیْ سَبِیْلِ اللّٰهِ اَمْوَاتٌ ؕ بَلْ اَحْیَآءٌ وَّ لٰكِنْ لَّا تَشْعُرُوْنَ۝۱۵۴

And do not say about those who are killed in the way of Allah, "They are dead." Rather, they are alive, but you perceive it not.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 154

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ لَنَبْلُوَنَّكُمْ بِشَیْءٍ مِّنَ الْخَوْفِ وَ الْجُوْعِ وَ نَقْصٍ مِّنَ الْاَمْوَالِ وَ الْاَنْفُسِ وَ الثَّمَرٰتِ ؕ وَ بَشِّرِ الصّٰبِرِیْنَۙ۝۱۵۵

And We will surely test you with something of fear and hunger and a loss of wealth and lives and fruits. But give good tidings to the patient.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 155

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

الَّذِیْنَ اِذَاۤ اَصَابَتْهُمْ مُّصِیْبَةٌ ۙ قَالُوْۤا اِنَّا لِلّٰهِ وَ اِنَّاۤ اِلَیْهِ رٰجِعُوْنَؕ۝۱۵۶

Who, when a calamity strikes them, say, "Indeed we belong to Allah, and indeed to Him we are to return."

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 156

Footnote :

This sentence contains an acknowledgment of two profound truths. First, since we all belong to Allah, He has the right to make any decision concerning us. Furthermore, because we are His and a master does not wish harm upon his own possessions, any of His decrees concerning us must be for our own good, even if we do not immediately understand it.

Second, it expresses the truth that one day we, too, must return to Allah, to the same place where our loved ones have gone. Therefore, this separation is temporary, not permanent. With this belief, there is hope of gaining a reward from Allah even due to this pain or distress. When the heart is firm in this belief, even if tears fall involuntarily, it is not a contradiction of patience.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اُولٰٓىِٕكَ عَلَیْهِمْ صَلَوٰتٌ مِّنْ رَّبِّهِمْ وَ رَحْمَةٌ ۫ وَ اُولٰٓىِٕكَ هُمُ الْمُهْتَدُوْنَ۝۱۵۷

Those are the ones upon whom are blessings from their Lord and mercy. And it is those who are the [rightly] guided.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 157

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اِنَّ الصَّفَا وَ الْمَرْوَةَ مِنْ شَعَآىِٕرِ اللّٰهِ ۚ فَمَنْ حَجَّ الْبَیْتَ اَوِ اعْتَمَرَ فَلَا جُنَاحَ عَلَیْهِ اَنْ یَّطَّوَّفَ بِهِمَا ؕ وَ مَنْ تَطَوَّعَ خَیْرًا ۙ فَاِنَّ اللّٰهَ شَاكِرٌ عَلِیْمٌ۝۱۵۸

Indeed, as-Safa and al-Marwah are among the symbols of Allah. So whoever makes Hajj to the House or performs 'Umrah - there is no blame upon him for walking between them. And whoever volunteers good - then indeed, Allah is Appreciative and Knowing.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 158

Footnote :

Safa and Marwah are two mountains in Makkah. When Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him) left his wife Hajra (may Allah be pleased with her) and their infant son Ismail (peace be upon him) in Makkah, Hajra ran between these two mountains in search of water. Allah the Almighty has made it obligatory to perform Sa'ee (running) between these two mountains during Hajj and Umrah.

Despite the fact that performing Sa'ee is obligatory, the words "there is no blame" were used here because during the Age of Ignorance, two idols were placed on these two mountains. The polytheists used to venerate them and believed that the purpose of Sa'ee was to show respect to them. Although the idols were removed after the conquest of Makkah, some companions had doubts, thinking that since running between these two mountains was a symbol of that era, doing so might be a sin. The verse removes that doubt for them.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اِنَّ الَّذِیْنَ یَكْتُمُوْنَ مَاۤ اَنْزَلْنَا مِنَ الْبَیِّنٰتِ وَ الْهُدٰی مِنْۢ بَعْدِ مَا بَیَّنّٰهُ لِلنَّاسِ فِی الْكِتٰبِ ۙ اُولٰٓىِٕكَ یَلْعَنُهُمُ اللّٰهُ وَ یَلْعَنُهُمُ اللّٰعِنُوْنَۙ۝۱۵۹

Indeed, those who conceal what We sent down of clear proofs and guidance after We made it clear for the people in the Scripture - those are cursed by Allah and cursed by the cursers.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 159

Footnote :

This refers to the Jews and Christians who concealed the good news about the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, which was given in the previous scriptures.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اِنَّ الَّذِیْنَ كَفَرُوْا وَ مَاتُوْا وَ هُمْ كُفَّارٌ اُولٰٓىِٕكَ عَلَیْهِمْ لَعْنَةُ اللّٰهِ وَ الْمَلٰٓىِٕكَةِ وَ النَّاسِ اَجْمَعِیْنَۙ۝۱۶۱

Indeed, those who disbelieved and died while they were disbelievers - upon them is the curse of Allah and the angels and the people, all together.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 161

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ اِلٰهُكُمْ اِلٰهٌ وَّاحِدٌ ۚ لَاۤ اِلٰهَ اِلَّا هُوَ الرَّحْمٰنُ الرَّحِیْمُ۠۝۱۶۳

And your god is one God. There is no deity [worthy of worship] except Him, the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 163

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اِنَّ فِیْ خَلْقِ السَّمٰوٰتِ وَ الْاَرْضِ وَ اخْتِلَافِ الَّیْلِ وَ النَّهَارِ وَ الْفُلْكِ الَّتِیْ تَجْرِیْ فِی الْبَحْرِ بِمَا یَنْفَعُ النَّاسَ وَ مَاۤ اَنْزَلَ اللّٰهُ مِنَ السَّمَآءِ مِنْ مَّآءٍ فَاَحْیَا بِهِ الْاَرْضَ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهَا وَ بَثَّ فِیْهَا مِنْ كُلِّ دَآبَّةٍ ۪ وَّ تَصْرِیْفِ الرِّیٰحِ وَ السَّحَابِ الْمُسَخَّرِ بَیْنَ السَّمَآءِ وَ الْاَرْضِ لَاٰیٰتٍ لِّقَوْمٍ یَّعْقِلُوْنَ۝۱۶۴

Indeed, in the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the alternation of the night and the day, and the [sailing of] ships through the sea with that which benefits humanity, and what Allah has sent down from the heavens of rain, giving life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness and dispersing therein every [kind of] moving creature, and the changing of the winds and clouds made subservient between the heaven and the earth - are signs for a people who use their intellect.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 164

Footnote :

In various places in the Quran, Allah the Almighty draws our attention to the phenomena of the universe that are spread out before our very eyes. When considered logically, these phenomena bear clear evidence of Allah’s existence and oneness. Because our eyes have grown accustomed to them, we do not feel they are wondrous. Otherwise, each one of these is part of a wondrous cosmic system, the creation of which is beyond the capacity of any power other than the immense power of Allah the Almighty.

The way the creations of the heavens and the earth continue to function, the way the sun and moon travel day and night according to a fixed schedule, the way the vast oceans connect different parts of the land through ships and transport necessary goods from one place to another, and the way clouds and wind arrange for the provisions of humanity—all of this makes it so that only an absolute ignoramus could think that these things came into existence on their own, without a creator.

The Arab polytheists also admitted that this universe was the creation of Allah the Almighty. However, they also held the belief that several deities were His helpers in these tasks. The Quran says, "The Being whose power is so vast that He created this wondrous universe without the partnership of anyone else—why would He need any partners or helpers for smaller tasks?"

Therefore, whoever uses their intellect and wisdom will find evidence of Allah’s oneness in every object of the world.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ مِنَ النَّاسِ مَنْ یَّتَّخِذُ مِنْ دُوْنِ اللّٰهِ اَنْدَادًا یُّحِبُّوْنَهُمْ كَحُبِّ اللّٰهِ ؕ وَ الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوْۤا اَشَدُّ حُبًّا لِّلّٰهِ ؕ وَ لَوْ یَرَی الَّذِیْنَ ظَلَمُوْۤا اِذْ یَرَوْنَ الْعَذَابَ ۙ اَنَّ الْقُوَّةَ لِلّٰهِ جَمِیْعًا ۙ وَّ اَنَّ اللّٰهَ شَدِیْدُ الْعَذَابِ۝۱۶۵

And [yet], among the people are those who take other than Allah as equals [to Him]. They love them as they should love Allah. But those who have believed are stronger in love for Allah. And if only they who have wronged would see when they see the punishment that all power belongs to Allah and that Allah is severe in punishment!

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 165

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

یٰۤاَیُّهَا النَّاسُ كُلُوْا مِمَّا فِی الْاَرْضِ حَلٰلًا طَیِّبًا ۖؗ وَّ لَا تَتَّبِعُوْا خُطُوٰتِ الشَّیْطٰنِ ؕ اِنَّهٗ لَكُمْ عَدُوٌّ مُّبِیْنٌ۝۱۶۸

O mankind, eat from whatever is on earth [that is] lawful and good and do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 168

Footnote :

A misguided belief of the Arab polytheists was that they arbitrarily declared various things as halal (lawful) or haram (unlawful) without any divine instruction. For example, they considered eating dead animals permissible, while they had made many lawful living creatures forbidden for themselves. A detailed discussion on this topic will come in Surah Al-An'am, God willing. This verse was revealed to refute their misguidance.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اِنَّمَا یَاْمُرُكُمْ بِالسُّوْٓءِ وَ الْفَحْشَآءِ وَ اَنْ تَقُوْلُوْا عَلَی اللّٰهِ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُوْنَ۝۱۶۹

He only orders you to evil and immorality and to say about Allah what you do not know.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 169

Footnote :

It commands you to formulate religious laws and rulings on your own, and even in matters of faith and creed, to propagate and follow fabricated opinions that contradict the Qur'an and Sunnah (based on Tafsir-e-Uthmani).
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ مَثَلُ الَّذِیْنَ كَفَرُوْا كَمَثَلِ الَّذِیْ یَنْعِقُ بِمَا لَا یَسْمَعُ اِلَّا دُعَآءً وَّ نِدَآءً ؕ صُمٌّۢ بُكْمٌ عُمْیٌ فَهُمْ لَا یَعْقِلُوْنَ۝۱۷۱

The example of those who disbelieve is like that of one who yells at that which hears nothing but calls and cries. [They are] deaf, dumb, and blind, so they do not reason.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 171

Footnote :

They do not hear the truth, they do not speak the truth, and they do not see the path of truth. Therefore, despite having the power of hearing, speech, and sight, they are like animals. Just like animals, they cannot distinguish between good and bad. In this state, a person who calls them toward faith is like a person who calls an animal—it only hears the sound, but does not understand its meaning.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

یٰۤاَیُّهَا الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوْا كُلُوْا مِنْ طَیِّبٰتِ مَا رَزَقْنٰكُمْ وَ اشْكُرُوْا لِلّٰهِ اِنْ كُنْتُمْ اِیَّاهُ تَعْبُدُوْنَ۝۱۷۲

O you who have believed, eat from the good things which We have provided for you and be grateful to Allah if it is [indeed] Him that you worship.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 172

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اِنَّمَا حَرَّمَ عَلَیْكُمُ الْمَیْتَةَ وَ الدَّمَ وَ لَحْمَ الْخِنْزِیْرِ وَ مَاۤ اُهِلَّ بِهٖ لِغَیْرِ اللّٰهِ ۚ فَمَنِ اضْطُرَّ غَیْرَ بَاغٍ وَّ لَا عَادٍ فَلَاۤ اِثْمَ عَلَیْهِ ؕ اِنَّ اللّٰهَ غَفُوْرٌ رَّحِیْمٌ۝۱۷۳

He has only forbidden to you dead animals, blood, the flesh of swine, and that which has been dedicated to other than Allah. But whoever is forced [by necessity], neither desiring [it] nor transgressing [its limit], there is no sin upon him. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 173

Footnote :

This verse is not intended to provide a comprehensive list of all forbidden things. Rather, its purpose is to convey that the animals you have arbitrarily deemed forbidden were not made so by Allah. You have wrongly attributed their prohibition to Him.

On the other hand, there are things you consider lawful that Allah has actually forbidden. The things you think are forbidden are not; instead, the things you consider lawful are the ones that are truly forbidden.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اِنَّ الَّذِیْنَ یَكْتُمُوْنَ مَاۤ اَنْزَلَ اللّٰهُ مِنَ الْكِتٰبِ وَ یَشْتَرُوْنَ بِهٖ ثَمَنًا قَلِیْلًا ۙ اُولٰٓىِٕكَ مَا یَاْكُلُوْنَ فِیْ بُطُوْنِهِمْ اِلَّا النَّارَ وَ لَا یُكَلِّمُهُمُ اللّٰهُ یَوْمَ الْقِیٰمَةِ وَ لَا یُزَكِّیْهِمْ ۖۚ وَ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ اَلِیْمٌ۝۱۷۴

Indeed, those who conceal what Allah has sent down of the Book and exchange it for a small price - those do not consume into their bellies except fire. And Allah will not speak to them on the Day of Resurrection, nor will He purify them, and they will have a painful punishment.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 174

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

لَیْسَ الْبِرَّ اَنْ تُوَلُّوْا وُجُوْهَكُمْ قِبَلَ الْمَشْرِقِ وَ الْمَغْرِبِ وَ لٰكِنَّ الْبِرَّ مَنْ اٰمَنَ بِاللّٰهِ وَ الْیَوْمِ الْاٰخِرِ وَ الْمَلٰٓىِٕكَةِ وَ الْكِتٰبِ وَ النَّبِیّٖنَ ۚ وَ اٰتَی الْمَالَ عَلٰی حُبِّهٖ ذَوِی الْقُرْبٰی وَ الْیَتٰمٰی وَ الْمَسٰكِیْنَ وَ ابْنَ السَّبِیْلِ ۙ وَ السَّآىِٕلِیْنَ وَ فِی الرِّقَابِ ۚ وَ اَقَامَ الصَّلٰوةَ وَ اٰتَی الزَّكٰوةَ ۚ وَ الْمُوْفُوْنَ بِعَهْدِهِمْ اِذَا عٰهَدُوْا ۚ وَ الصّٰبِرِیْنَ فِی الْبَاْسَآءِ وَ الضَّرَّآءِ وَ حِیْنَ الْبَاْسِ ؕ اُولٰٓىِٕكَ الَّذِیْنَ صَدَقُوْا ؕ وَ اُولٰٓىِٕكَ هُمُ الْمُتَّقُوْنَ۝۱۷۷

Righteousness is not that you turn your faces toward the east or the west, but [true] righteousness is [in] one who believes in Allah, the Last Day, the angels, the Book, and the prophets and gives wealth, in spite of love for it, to relatives, orphans, the needy, the traveler, those who ask [for help], and for the freeing of slaves; [and who] establishes prayer and gives zakah; [those who] fulfill their promise when they promise; and [those who] are patient in poverty and hardship and during battle. Those are the ones who have been true, and it is those who are the righteous.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 177

Footnote :

This is addressed to the People of the Book (Jews and Christians) who had started debating and analyzing the Qibla in such a way as if there was no other more important matter in religion. The Muslims are being told that the issue of the Qibla has been clarified as much as needed. Now, it is your duty to focus on other essential aspects of religion.

The People of the Book should also be told that a more important matter than debating the Qibla is to correct their faith and to develop the qualities that faith demands. In this regard, the Quran has provided details of various branches of righteous deeds and has highlighted different aspects of Islamic law. These will be discussed one by one going forward.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

یٰۤاَیُّهَا الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوْا كُتِبَ عَلَیْكُمُ الْقِصَاصُ فِی الْقَتْلٰی ؕ اَلْحُرُّ بِالْحُرِّ وَ الْعَبْدُ بِالْعَبْدِ وَ الْاُنْثٰی بِالْاُنْثٰی ؕ فَمَنْ عُفِیَ لَهٗ مِنْ اَخِیْهِ شَیْءٌ فَاتِّبَاعٌۢ بِالْمَعْرُوْفِ وَ اَدَآءٌ اِلَیْهِ بِاِحْسَانٍ ؕ ذٰلِكَ تَخْفِیْفٌ مِّنْ رَّبِّكُمْ وَ رَحْمَةٌ ؕ فَمَنِ اعْتَدٰی بَعْدَ ذٰلِكَ فَلَهٗ عَذَابٌ اَلِیْمٌ۝۱۷۸

O you who have believed, prescribed for you is legal retribution for those murdered - the free for the free, the slave for the slave, and the female for the female. But whoever overlooks from his brother anything, then there should be a suitable follow-up and payment to him with good conduct. This is an alleviation from your Lord and a mercy. But whoever transgresses after that will have a painful punishment.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 178

Footnote :

Qisas means to take an equal amount of retaliation. This verse commands that if a person is intentionally and unjustly killed and the killer's crime is proven, the heirs of the deceased have the right to demand Qisas from the killer.
In the Age of Ignorance (Jahiliyyah), Qisas was also practiced, but justice was not maintained. They had created different social classes according to their own ideas, and if a person of a lower class killed someone of a higher class, the heirs of the deceased would seek to kill someone from the killer's tribe who was equal in status to the deceased, instead of the killer himself. If a slave killed a free person, they would demand that a free person be killed in place of the slave. Similarly, if the killer was a woman and the victim was a man, they would say that a man would be killed in place of the woman. On the other hand, if the killer was of a higher status than the victim, for example, if the killer was a man and the victim was a woman, the killer's tribe would say, "Kill one of our women; Qisas cannot be taken from the male killer."
This verse nullified this unjust practice of the Age of Ignorance and declared that all lives are equal. In all circumstances, Qisas will be taken from the killer himself, whether the killer is a man or a woman, a free person or a slave.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ لَكُمْ فِی الْقِصَاصِ حَیٰوةٌ یّٰۤاُولِی الْاَلْبَابِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَتَّقُوْنَ۝۱۷۹

He has only forbidden to you dead animals, blood, the flesh of swine, and that which has been dedicated to other than Allah. But whoever is forced [by necessity], neither desiring [it] nor transgressing [its limit], there is no sin upon him. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 179

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

فَمَنْۢ بَدَّلَهٗ بَعْدَ مَا سَمِعَهٗ فَاِنَّمَاۤ اِثْمُهٗ عَلَی الَّذِیْنَ یُبَدِّلُوْنَهٗ ؕ اِنَّ اللّٰهَ سَمِیْعٌ عَلِیْمٌؕ۝۱۸۱

Then whoever alters the bequest after he has heard it - the sin is only upon those who have altered it. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 181

Footnote :

For those who have heard a will from a dying person, it is absolutely forbidden for them to make any additions or subtractions to that will. Instead, their duty is to act strictly according to what the testator has said.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

فَمَنْ خَافَ مِنْ مُّوْصٍ جَنَفًا اَوْ اِثْمًا فَاَصْلَحَ بَیْنَهُمْ فَلَاۤ اِثْمَ عَلَیْهِ ؕ اِنَّ اللّٰهَ غَفُوْرٌ رَّحِیْمٌ۠۝۱۸۲

But if one fears from the bequeather [some] error or sin and corrects that which is between them, there is no sin upon him. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 182

Footnote :

Those who have a dying person's will and fear that the person is making an unjust will may approach them and try to convince them to rectify it before death. If the dying person agrees to amend the will, this is permissible.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

یٰۤاَیُّهَا الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوْا كُتِبَ عَلَیْكُمُ الصِّیَامُ كَمَا كُتِبَ عَلَی الَّذِیْنَ مِنْ قَبْلِكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَتَّقُوْنَۙ۝۱۸۳

O you who have believed, decreed upon you is fasting as it was decreed upon those before you that you may become righteous

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 183

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اَیَّامًا مَّعْدُوْدٰتٍ ؕ فَمَنْ كَانَ مِنْكُمْ مَّرِیْضًا اَوْ عَلٰی سَفَرٍ فَعِدَّةٌ مِّنْ اَیَّامٍ اُخَرَ ؕ وَ عَلَی الَّذِیْنَ یُطِیْقُوْنَهٗ فِدْیَةٌ طَعَامُ مِسْكِیْنٍ ؕ فَمَنْ تَطَوَّعَ خَیْرًا فَهُوَ خَیْرٌ لَّهٗ ؕ وَ اَنْ تَصُوْمُوْا خَیْرٌ لَّكُمْ اِنْ كُنْتُمْ تَعْلَمُوْنَ۝۱۸۴

[Fasting for] a limited number of days. So whoever among you is ill or on a journey [during them] - then an equal number of days [are to be made up]. And upon those who are able [to fast, but with hardship] - a ransom [as substitute] of feeding a poor person [each day]. And whoever volunteers excess - it is better for him. But to fast is best for you, if you only knew.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 184

Footnote :

When fasting was first made obligatory, a concession was given that a person could choose to not fast and instead give fidyah (a compensatory payment). Subsequently, verse 185, which will come later, was revealed. This verse withdrew that concession and gave the final instruction that anyone who witnesses the month of Ramadan must fast. However, for those who are extremely old and do not have the strength to fast, with no hope of ever regaining that strength, this concession remains.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

شَهْرُ رَمَضَانَ الَّذِیْۤ اُنْزِلَ فِیْهِ الْقُرْاٰنُ هُدًی لِّلنَّاسِ وَ بَیِّنٰتٍ مِّنَ الْهُدٰی وَ الْفُرْقَانِ ۚ فَمَنْ شَهِدَ مِنْكُمُ الشَّهْرَ فَلْیَصُمْهُ ؕ وَ مَنْ كَانَ مَرِیْضًا اَوْ عَلٰی سَفَرٍ فَعِدَّةٌ مِّنْ اَیَّامٍ اُخَرَ ؕ یُرِیْدُ اللّٰهُ بِكُمُ الْیُسْرَ وَ لَا یُرِیْدُ بِكُمُ الْعُسْرَ ؗ وَ لِتُكْمِلُوا الْعِدَّةَ وَ لِتُكَبِّرُوا اللّٰهَ عَلٰی مَا هَدٰىكُمْ وَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُوْنَ۝۱۸۵

The month of Ramadhan [is that] in which was revealed the Qur'an, a guidance for the people and clear proofs of guidance and criterion. So whoever sights [the new moon of] the month, let him fast it; and whoever is ill or on a journey - then an equal number of other days. Allah intends for you ease and does not intend for you hardship and [wants] for you to complete the period and to glorify Allah for that [to] which He has guided you; and perhaps you will be grateful.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 185

Footnote :

A subtle hint to the takbir said in the Eid al-Fitr prayer, right after Ramadan ends, can be found in this verse.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

شَهْرُ رَمَضَانَ الَّذِیْۤ اُنْزِلَ فِیْهِ الْقُرْاٰنُ هُدًی لِّلنَّاسِ وَ بَیِّنٰتٍ مِّنَ الْهُدٰی وَ الْفُرْقَانِ ۚ فَمَنْ شَهِدَ مِنْكُمُ الشَّهْرَ فَلْیَصُمْهُ ؕ وَ مَنْ كَانَ مَرِیْضًا اَوْ عَلٰی سَفَرٍ فَعِدَّةٌ مِّنْ اَیَّامٍ اُخَرَ ؕ یُرِیْدُ اللّٰهُ بِكُمُ الْیُسْرَ وَ لَا یُرِیْدُ بِكُمُ الْعُسْرَ ؗ وَ لِتُكْمِلُوا الْعِدَّةَ وَ لِتُكَبِّرُوا اللّٰهَ عَلٰی مَا هَدٰىكُمْ وَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُوْنَ۝۱۸۵

The month of Ramadhan [is that] in which was revealed the Qur'an, a guidance for the people and clear proofs of guidance and criterion. So whoever sights [the new moon of] the month, let him fast it; and whoever is ill or on a journey - then an equal number of other days. Allah intends for you ease and does not intend for you hardship and [wants] for you to complete the period and to glorify Allah for that [to] which He has guided you; and perhaps you will be grateful.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 185

Footnote :

A subtle hint to the takbir said in the Eid al-Fitr prayer, right after Ramadan ends, can be found in this verse.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ اِذَا سَاَلَكَ عِبَادِیْ عَنِّیْ فَاِنِّیْ قَرِیْبٌ ؕ اُجِیْبُ دَعْوَةَ الدَّاعِ اِذَا دَعَانِ ۙ فَلْیَسْتَجِیْبُوْا لِیْ وَ لْیُؤْمِنُوْا بِیْ لَعَلَّهُمْ یَرْشُدُوْنَ۝۱۸۶

And when My servants ask you, [O Muhammad], concerning Me - indeed I am near. I respond to the invocation of the supplicant when he calls upon Me. So let them respond to Me [by obedience] and believe in Me that they may be [rightly] guided.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 186

Footnote :

The purpose of including this verse in the middle of the discussion about Ramadan is likely to counter the idea that might have arisen from the previous mention of completing the days of Ramadan. Someone might have thought that after Ramadan ends, the closeness with Allah that was felt during the month would disappear. This verse refutes that notion and clearly states that Allah the Almighty is with His servant at every moment and He listens to their call.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اُحِلَّ لَكُمْ لَیْلَةَ الصِّیَامِ الرَّفَثُ اِلٰی نِسَآىِٕكُمْ ؕ هُنَّ لِبَاسٌ لَّكُمْ وَ اَنْتُمْ لِبَاسٌ لَّهُنَّ ؕ عَلِمَ اللّٰهُ اَنَّكُمْ كُنْتُمْ تَخْتَانُوْنَ اَنْفُسَكُمْ فَتَابَ عَلَیْكُمْ وَ عَفَا عَنْكُمْ ۚ فَالْـٰٔنَ بَاشِرُوْهُنَّ وَ ابْتَغُوْا مَا كَتَبَ اللّٰهُ لَكُمْ ۪ وَ كُلُوْا وَ اشْرَبُوْا حَتّٰی یَتَبَیَّنَ لَكُمُ الْخَیْطُ الْاَبْیَضُ مِنَ الْخَیْطِ الْاَسْوَدِ مِنَ الْفَجْرِ ۪ ثُمَّ اَتِمُّوا الصِّیَامَ اِلَی الَّیْلِ ۚ وَ لَا تُبَاشِرُوْهُنَّ وَ اَنْتُمْ عٰكِفُوْنَ ۙ فِی الْمَسٰجِدِ ؕ تِلْكَ حُدُوْدُ اللّٰهِ فَلَا تَقْرَبُوْهَا ؕ كَذٰلِكَ یُبَیِّنُ اللّٰهُ اٰیٰتِهٖ لِلنَّاسِ لَعَلَّهُمْ یَتَّقُوْنَ۝۱۸۷

It has been made permissible for you the night preceding fasting to go to your wives [for sexual relations]. They are clothing for you and you are clothing for them. Allah knows that you used to deceive yourselves, so He accepted your repentance and forgave you. So now, have relations with them and seek that which Allah has decreed for you. And eat and drink until the white thread of dawn becomes distinct to you from the black thread [of night]. Then complete the fast until the sunset. And do not have relations with them as long as you are staying for worship in the mosques. These are the limits [set by] Allah, so do not approach them. Thus does Allah make clear His ordinances to the people that they may become righteous.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 187

Footnote :

Most exegetes have interpreted this to mean that during intercourse with one's wife, the intention should be to have a child, which Allah has decreed in destiny. Some exegetes have also explained that during intercourse, one should only seek the pleasure that Allah has made lawful. It is an obligation to avoid all unlawful methods, such as perverse and unnatural ways.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ لَا تَاْكُلُوْۤا اَمْوَالَكُمْ بَیْنَكُمْ بِالْبَاطِلِ وَ تُدْلُوْا بِهَاۤ اِلَی الْحُكَّامِ لِتَاْكُلُوْا فَرِیْقًا مِّنْ اَمْوَالِ النَّاسِ بِالْاِثْمِ وَ اَنْتُمْ تَعْلَمُوْنَ۠۝۱۸۸

And do not consume one another's wealth unjustly or send it [in bribery] to the rulers in order that [they might aid] you [to] consume a portion of the wealth of the people in sin, while you know [it is unlawful].

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 173

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

یَسْـَٔلُوْنَكَ عَنِ الْاَهِلَّةِ ؕ قُلْ هِیَ مَوَاقِیْتُ لِلنَّاسِ وَ الْحَجِّ ؕ وَ لَیْسَ الْبِرُّ بِاَنْ تَاْتُوا الْبُیُوْتَ مِنْ ظُهُوْرِهَا وَ لٰكِنَّ الْبِرَّ مَنِ اتَّقٰی ۚ وَ اْتُوا الْبُیُوْتَ مِنْ اَبْوَابِهَا ۪ وَ اتَّقُوا اللّٰهَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُوْنَ۝۱۸۹

They ask you, [O Muhammad], about the new moons. Say, "They are measurements of time for the people and for Hajj." And it is not righteousness to enter houses from the back, but righteousness is [in] one who fears Allah. And enter houses from their doors. And fear Allah that you may succeed.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 189

Footnote :

A practice of some Arabs was that after entering the state of ihram for Hajj, if they needed to return home for any reason, they did not consider it permissible to enter the house through the regular door. In such cases, they would enter from the back of the house. Because of this, they would not hesitate to break down the back wall if necessary. This verse invalidates that superstition of theirs.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ قَاتِلُوْا فِیْ سَبِیْلِ اللّٰهِ الَّذِیْنَ یُقَاتِلُوْنَكُمْ وَ لَا تَعْتَدُوْا ؕ اِنَّ اللّٰهَ لَا یُحِبُّ الْمُعْتَدِیْنَ۝۱۹۰

Fight in the way of Allah those who fight you but do not transgress. Indeed. Allah does not like transgressors.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 190

Footnote :

This verse was revealed when the polytheists of Makkah prevented the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and his companions from performing 'Umrah during the Treaty of Hudaybiyah. A new agreement was made that they would perform 'Umrah the following year. When the time came to perform 'Umrah the next year, some companions were apprehensive, thinking, "What if the polytheists of Makkah break the treaty and start a war with us? If something like that happens, the Muslims will be in a difficult situation. How can they fight within the sacred precincts and especially in the month of Dhu al-Qadah? After all, fighting is not permissible in this month."

This verse provided the guidance that the Muslims should not initiate the war themselves. However, if the disbelievers break the treaty and start a war on their own, then it is permissible for the Muslims to fight. If they disregard the sanctity of the sacred precincts and the holy month and launch an attack, it will be permissible for the Muslims to retaliate against their transgression.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ قٰتِلُوْهُمْ حَتّٰی لَا تَكُوْنَ فِتْنَةٌ وَّ یَكُوْنَ الدِّیْنُ لِلّٰهِ ؕ فَاِنِ انْتَهَوْا فَلَا عُدْوَانَ اِلَّا عَلَی الظّٰلِمِیْنَ۝۱۹۳

Fight them until there is no [more] fitnah and [until] worship is [acknowledged to be] for Allah. But if they cease, then there is to be no aggression except against the oppressors.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 193

Footnote :

It is important to understand at this point that the purpose of jihad in the Shari'ah is not to force anyone to accept Islam. For this reason, in normal circumstances, if someone wishes to remain in disbelief, they can do so by paying jizyah and showing respect for the laws of the Islamic state.

The case of the Arabian Peninsula is different. This is a land to which the Prophet (peace be upon him) was sent directly, and where people saw his miracles with their own eyes and heard his teachings firsthand. In the times of previous prophets, such people who did not believe were destroyed by a widespread punishment. Since such a punishment was suspended in the time of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), the command was given that no disbeliever can live as a citizen in the Arabian Peninsula. For them, there are only three options: either they accept Islam, they leave the Arabian Peninsula, or they are killed in battle.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اَلْحَجُّ اَشْهُرٌ مَّعْلُوْمٰتٌ ۚ فَمَنْ فَرَضَ فِیْهِنَّ الْحَجَّ فَلَا رَفَثَ وَ لَا فُسُوْقَ ۙ وَ لَا جِدَالَ فِی الْحَجِّ ؕ وَ مَا تَفْعَلُوْا مِنْ خَیْرٍ یَّعْلَمْهُ اللّٰهُ ؔؕ وَ تَزَوَّدُوْا فَاِنَّ خَیْرَ الزَّادِ التَّقْوٰی ؗ وَ اتَّقُوْنِ یٰۤاُولِی الْاَلْبَابِ۝۱۹۷

Hajj is [during] well-known months, so whoever has made Hajj obligatory upon himself therein [by entering the state of ihram], there is [to be for him] no sexual relations and no disobedience and no disputing during Hajj. Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 197

Footnote :

Some people, when they set out for Hajj, would not take any provisions with them, saying, "We will perform Hajj by putting our trust in Allah." But when they needed to eat on the way, they were often forced to beg from others. This verse states that tawakkul (reliance on Allah) does not mean that a person should sit idly; rather, the way of the Shari'ah is to take the necessary means. The best provision is taqwa (piety), which is the provision that allows a person to avoid begging from others.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

A Common Misconception

Due to the propaganda of Christian missionaries, many Muslims mistakenly believe that the current Bible is the authentic Torah and Gospel. This idea is incorrect. The original Torah and Gospel have vanished from the earth. The Bible in use today is a book primarily about the life of Prophet Isa (Jesus), written by various individuals. It contains numerous distortions and contradictory statements, a fact even acknowledged by Christian researchers.

Our Islamic Beliefs on This Matter

Belief in the Original Scriptures: Our faith is not in the currently available Bible, but in the original Torah and Gospel that were revealed by Allah to Prophet Musa (Moses) and Prophet Isa (Jesus), respectively.

Truth of Previous Scriptures: Those original scriptures were entirely true and were to be followed until the arrival of the final Prophet, Muhammad (peace be upon him). They also contained prophecies and glad tidings about his coming.

Distortion and Concealment: Jewish and Christian scholars knowingly corrupted these books and concealed their teachings.

Supremacy of the Quran: After the revelation of the Quran, it became the only divine guide for all of humanity. The Quran superseded all previous scriptures and their laws. Now, only those rulings from the previous scriptures that are confirmed by the Quran remain applicable.

Source: Monthly Al Kawsar, January-2007, www.alkawsar.com

What should be said in response to the words "Ashhadu anna Muhammadar Rasulullah" in the Adhan and Iqamah?

When it comes to responding to the Adhan and Iqamah, it is a well-known Sunnah (a recommended practice) to repeat the phrases the Mu'adhdhin says.

However, there are two common phrases with different responses:

For 'Hayya 'alas-salah' (Come to prayer) and 'Hayya 'alal-falah' (Come to success), the listener should say 'La hawla wa la quwwata illa billah' (There is no might or power except with Allah).

For 'Ash-hadu anna Muhammadar Rasulullah' (I bear witness that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah), the correct response is to repeat the same phrase.

Some people mistakenly say 'Sallallahu 'alayhi wa sallam' in response to 'Ash-hadu anna Muhammadar Rasulullah', but this is not the correct response. The proper response is to repeat the original phrase. You can certainly say 'Sallallahu 'alayhi wa sallam' afterwards, but it does not serve as the official response to that part of the Adhan.

Source: Monthly Al-Kawthar, January-2007 www.alkawsar.com

This is not a Hadith.

A Baseless Story: The Adhan of Hazrat Bilal (R.A.)
A story circulated in a sermon by a speaker claims that the Prophet's (peace be upon him) Mu'adhdhin, Hazrat Bilal (R.A.), could not properly pronounce the letter 'Shīn' and instead pronounced it as 'Sīn'. Because of this supposed faulty pronunciation, he was relieved of his duty as the Mu'adhdhin and was replaced by someone who could pronounce the words correctly.
The story continues that the next day, Jibreel (A.S.) came to the Prophet (peace be upon him) and asked if the adhan had not been given in his mosque that day. The Prophet (peace be upon him) replied, "Yes, a very good adhan was given, better than before." Jibreel (A.S.) then said, "The previous adhan of Bilal used to reach the Throne of Allah, but today's adhan did not." He then revealed the reason: "To Allah, Bilal's pronunciation of 'Sīn' is considered 'Shīn'."

Analysis from an Islamic Perspective
This entire incident is a fabricated, baseless, and concocted story. It has no connection whatsoever to any authentic Hadith of the Prophet (peace be upon him). On the contrary, clear narrations from authentic Hadith state that Hazrat Bilal (R.A.) was a very eloquent speaker with a clear, loud, and melodious voice. This is why he was chosen to give the adhan. Hadith experts have definitively stated that this type of narration has no basis.

Source: Monthly Al-Kawthar, January-2007 www.alkawsar.com

Is Eid al-Adha a Festival of Slaughter?

Qurbani: Not a Festival of Animal Slaughter, but an Act of Worship to Gain Proximity to Allah
Some people, due to ignorance, mistakenly think of Eid al-Adha as a festival of animal slaughter or a ritual similar to the Hindu practice of bolidan. This notion is entirely incorrect.
The word 'Qurbani' itself means 'to gain proximity'. Therefore, 'Qurbani Eid' is the 'Eid of gaining proximity to Allah'. It is an act of worship where Muslims sacrifice an animal, given to them by Allah, in His name and for His pleasure. It is not merely a festival for eating meat; rather, it is an act of worship founded on the pure principles of Tawhid (monotheism) and the Sunnah (the practice of the Prophet).

Source: Monthly Al-Kawthar, February-2007 www.alkawsar.com

Is a Mukabbir Needed for Supplications?

Common Mistakes in Collective Supplication (Dua) After Prayers

In many mosques, a peculiar practice can be observed. While there is no mukabbir (one who loudly repeats the phrases) during the prayer itself, the Mu'adhdhin suddenly becomes a mukabbir for the supplication (dua). When the Imam raises his hands for dua, the Mu'adhdhin says aloud, 'Allahumma Amin,' and when it concludes, he says, 'Birrahmatika ya Arhamar Rahimin.' This traditional practice contains several issues that require correction:

Considering it Obligatory: Collective dua after the prayer is often considered an obligatory act, even though it is not.

Starting and Ending Together: People believe it is necessary for everyone to begin and end their dua at the same time. This is not a requirement, as the rules of congregational prayer do not apply to dua.

Misconception: This practice can give rise to the misconception that congregating for dua is more important than for prayer. There is, however, no religious instruction to have a mukabbir for dua.

Disturbing the Worshipper: The Imam's or Mu'adhdhin's loud supplication can disrupt the prayer of a masbuq (a latecomer) who is still completing his prayer, which is not permissible in Islamic law.

Violation of Supplication Etiquette: It is a recommended practice (mustahab) to begin a dua with praise and glorification of Allah, which is typically not followed in this conventional method.

These points indicate that this common practice of collective dua is based on a number of misconceptions and therefore requires correction.

Source: Monthly Al-Kawthar, February-2007 (www.alkawsar.com)

Is it Mustahab to Fast on the Days of the Ijtema?

Is Fasting during the Bishwa Ijtema a Special Act of Worship?

No, it is not a special act of worship. The belief held by some people, particularly women in certain regions, that fasting during the days of the Bishwa Ijtema in Tongi is a special act of worship is a wrong and baseless notion.

Understanding the Ruling

Voluntary Fasting (Nafal Roza): Voluntary fasts can be performed on any day. However, only those fasts that are specifically encouraged in the Hadith (such as the fast on the 9th of Dhul Hijjah, the day of Ashura, or the "white days" of the month) hold a special virtue.

The Days of Ijtema: The date, location, and time of the Bishwa Ijtema are determined based on logistical convenience and not on any religious injunction (Shari'ah). Therefore, it is incorrect to consider fasting on these specific days as a mustahab or a special act of worship.

The Correct Practice: Fasting on the days of the Ijtema will be considered a general voluntary fast, which carries a general reward. However, believing it to be a special act of worship specifically connected to the Ijtema is a misconception that should be avoided.

In short, fasting on the days of the Ijtema is a regular voluntary fast, not a special one.

Source: Monthly Al-Kawthar, February-2007 (www.alkawsar.com)

The Misconception of Arbitrarily Considering Certain Mosques to have Special Virtue

A common misconception exists among people, especially women, that praying in old, "national," or shrine-adjacent mosques yields greater spiritual reward (sawab). This belief is Islamically baseless.

From an Islamic perspective, with the exception of three mosques, all mosques in the world are equal in status and in the reward they carry. These three mosques of special virtue are: Masjid al-Haram, Masjid an-Nabawi, and Masjid al-Aqsa. According to a Hadith, it is only permissible to undertake a journey specifically for these three mosques.

Designating a mosque as 'national' or the presence of a shrine (mazar) nearby does not increase its religious virtue. However, there is no prohibition on going to another mosque if it has a learned scholar or provides religious education, for the purpose of acquiring knowledge. The main objective is to correct the misconception regarding spiritual reward.

Source: Monthly Al-Kawsar, March-2007, www.alkawsar.com

Is 'Hisn-e-Hasin' a Book for 'Khatam' (Group Recitation) or 'Wazifa' (Daily Litany)?

'Hisn-e-Hasin' is a famous book of compiled duas (supplications) from the Hadith, authored by the Muhaddith Ibnul Jazari (Rh.). It is structured with specific supplications to be read at various times and in different situations, not as a book of 'Wazifa' (daily litany) or for 'Khatam' (group recitation) during times of calamity.

However, instead of using the book for its primary purpose—which is to read the right supplication at the right time—most people use it merely for 'Khatam' during calamities or as a daily 'Wazifa'.

According to the author, there is an Urdu version of the book compiled by Maulana Idris (Rh.), whose presentation encourages reading the supplications correctly. Therefore, a Bengali translation of this version is needed.

Source: Monthly Al-Kawsar, March-2007, www.alkawsar.com

Is Hajj-e-Akbar the name for a Hajj that falls on a Friday?

It's a popular belief that if the Day of Arafah falls on a Friday, that Hajj is called Hajj-e-Akbar. Some people also think that the term 'Yom Al-Hajj Al-Akbar' (the Day of the Greater Pilgrimage) in Surah At-Tawbah of the Quran refers to this Friday Hajj.

This belief is incorrect. In the Quran, the phrase 'Yom Al-Hajj Al-Akbar' doesn't mean Friday; it simply refers to Hajj itself, regardless of which day it falls on. The reason Hajj is called 'Akbar' (greater) is because it's a type of pilgrimage, while Umrah is considered a smaller pilgrimage. Therefore, Hajj is the 'greater pilgrimage' and Umrah is the 'smaller pilgrimage'.

It's true that when Hajj falls on a Friday, the blessings of the Day of Arafah and the blessings of Friday combine, giving it special significance. However, this is a separate matter and not related to the term 'Hajj-e-Akbar' mentioned in the Quran.

Source: Monthly Al-Kawthar, March-2007, www.alkawsar.com

Addressing the Grave and the Grave's Reply

It is said that a speaker claimed that during the burial of Hazrat Fatima (R.A.), the companions addressed the grave, saying, "O grave, be careful! Do you know who is being placed inside you? She is the beloved daughter of Sayyidul Alamin (the leader of all worlds)." In response, the grave supposedly replied, "Lineage doesn't matter to me; here, everyone will be judged by their deeds."

This story is completely baseless. There is no mention of it in any reliable Hadith or history book. The companions would not have said such a thing, as they were well aware that the reckoning in the afterlife is based solely on faith and deeds. The Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) himself told his daughter, Fatima (R.A.), "O Fatima, save yourself from the fire of Hell, for I have no power to benefit or harm you." Therefore, the idea that the companions would address the grave in this manner is absurd.

Source: Monthly Al-Kawthar, March-2007, www.alkawsar.com

No, tht's not true. It is incorrect to say that Friday prayers can never be valid in an open field.

Some people object to the Friday prayers held at the Tongi Ijtema, claiming they are invalid because they are performed in an open field rather than a designated mosque. However, this idea is incorrect.

While it is a confirmed Sunnah to perform all congregational prayers, including the Friday prayer, in a dedicated mosque, having a mosque is not a mandatory condition for the prayer's validity. The Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) stated that the entire earth has been made a place of prayer (masjid) for the Muslim community.

In the case of the Tongi Ijtema, millions of people gather, making it impossible for them to fit into the local mosques. In this unavoidable situation, performing the prayer in an open field is completely permissible and valid according to Islamic law. This is considered an exceptional circumstance and not a general rule.
